NtxBWMRlT_WhL-l1a5lYwA.text: We were looking for Mexican near our hotel. This was delicious!  I would come back hear again! The Queso and the Hanenero Blood Orange enchiladas were amazing!!!

hOQrbTl6ANjLMCeaKQPitQ.text: Delicious food, decent portions, beautifully presented and not overpriced; sinfully good margaritas; friendly and attentive staff; great ambiance and tasteful decor is a mix of modern and traditional with attention to details; and terrific happy hour deals. For me, this place sets the bar for the biggest bang for your buck in Vegas. I'll be back for sure.

GSrK3Kgj9x8z6VEiiGe4dw.text: Great service ! great happy hour ....staff went above and beyond . Sopes and salsa were great my life liked the ceviche ...slip the guacamole  ...margaritas were strong . Didn't delve into the main menu but will probably try one day . All in all great value for happy hour ..cool space good vibe

hRcHACfihYY6rYvx2bGxjw.text: Food was really good the location inside is a nice change from the typical Mexican restaurants around town. I would visit again.

C1NpnI6OUGnb7dJFdMG1NA.text: I had a very solid meal for lunch.  We chose this place as it's conveniently located near the office I work at.  Plenty of room for a big group on a weekday at noon.  Our table ordered a bit of everything and were pleasantly surprised by the presentation of the dishes.  The food looked a little higher end than your typical Mexican restaurant.  The dishes also leaned towards a more healthy alternative rather than the usual beans and rice base of Mexican food.  Personally I had the Chipotle veggie wrap with street corn.  I thought the dish was very good, but could have used a little more spice.  Still, it offered healthy wrap at an affordable business lunch price.  The other standouts at the table appearance-wise were the turkey salad, steak sandwich, and tacos in general.  The salsa and chips are typical and nothing too unique.  The service wasn't the fastest and the dishes came out in groups rather than all together so many of the diners had food for 10 minutes before our last person received their dish (10 people total).  Seemed like they need to get the food preparation and timing down; that will come in time as Bandito did only recently open.  But overall a nice addition to the area.

ZLVXqzhfkvXMQIVRVXGWpw.text: We went to dinner last night with a group of 12. The smoking Bandito Margarita was delicious. Fantastic cocktails overall. Food was amazing and service was the best! Highly recommended!!

GH8gjOf6WVrsqDnmWH9fjg.text: Went to Bandito's the first week they opened.  Ordered the carnitas tacos.    The waiter brought out our items at different times and brought me the wrong item.  When my item showed up, it was barely room temp.  Overall flavor was good but needed a sauce or something to liven it up. They also need some hotter salsa.  The waitress over charged us for the sides even though they were included.  It all ended up being fixed but the lunch turned into an exceptionally long lunch.  The decor is fabulous and very chic.  Very modern and inviting.  Will have to go back after they have been open a bit longer...perhaps for happy hour.

AB322qVBWgg25sb4hcWLQw.text: Every bite and every sip was fresh and full of flavor. We travel a lot and eat at many fine restaurants. This rivals anything we've eaten. Superb!!!

BLBGWPYNZmRtLGBf88yfpQ.text: Love it! The food it amazing, very flavorful and creative. I had a turkey taco salad and it was not what I was expecting but absolutely delish. The service was fantastic, some of the best I've ever had. The atmosphere was beautiful. Definitely coming back here!

OBp2JWAQCoS_LMKBmQTRBw.text: This place is sooo cute! Went for happy hour and enjoyed all the food and of course the margaritas! Marcus (bartender) was great! Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pZHfB8pexzdQYoZGgnE2lw.text: Overall good experience at Bandito. Chips and salsa were great. I got the Smoking Bandito Margarita (half off during happy hour) and it was decent. I only wish there had been a pineapple wedge in it. The queso fondido was soooooo amazing. My favorite thing of the whole meal. We also ordered the fish tacos (not great) and the pastor tacos (pretty good but would be better shredded instead of cubed). For our side we got the corn which was delicious. The only think I would change is that the plates are so tiny! It was hard to eat off.  I LOVED the decor and atmosphere. Staff was excellent. We will return to try more.

MrUoZa3ADN7fEClRFzAdYw.text: Greet new restaurant opening in Las Vegas.   The enchilada was superb.   Service was great and your meal isn't complete until your try their margaritas

tJoHlalOeXHaDWCYt0CgQw.text: Great Mexican inspired restaurant. The highest quality fresh ingredients are used in everything. I had the guacamole, which was outstanding and the carnitas enchiladas. The enchiladas are made with cheese only and then you pick the sauce and meat. A great lunch, I certainly plan to go back.

Ww4ZqNL-bsRgSqwdhUSYbA.text: Great place for good food and a relaxing environment. Staff is excellent and very friendly

bGw3LXo0IpEdyGrqSO6MNw.text: Great service, food was kind of pricey but tasted great.  Overall a pretty good experience, and a nice off the strip location!

idT-6saWvWq6DcJrgSaMEw.text: We are very pleased to stop by here.tge service it was amazing and great waiter Suzanne help us and she with the menu,what a food congratulations for the Chef

9GC01kQD9u094Cd_iSwQ1A.text: A True Mexican food restaurant, if your looking for something beyond fried taco which you'll find at Robertos and the Michoacan restaurants give Bandito a try.  Totally recommend the ceviche which is a mix of shrimp, octopus and a firm white fish and several citrus fruits and passion fruit, great new little twist.  Street style tacos were great tried grilled halibut, carne asada and carnitas all were on point and great tasting.  Definitely try a mixed drink, venture past the Margaritas and try something new.  Both the wife and I tried their house specials and loved them well worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QWpDZOKL5q13n9QkLVJYoQ.text: They asked if we wanted tap water or bottle of water. I decided bottle, and thought it was nice to have a choice. But if I was told it was $8 I would have picked tap. That was the biggest bummer. Food was good. My favorite was the street corn. I had the barbacoa taco platter. It was all tasty but it is pricy. Happy hour has select drinks and appetizer half off. I would come again but make sure to come during HH.

v7plnI8IeokdtV5xmdcyxA.text: I highly recommend this restaurant. The staff (especially Marco) is friendly and the margaritas are awesome!!! Great looking establishment. I will be back.

RZmLB20muq3kPoSiDUKmiA.text: The food here is amazing!!  The decor is super nice as well.  Will definitely return as often as possible.

o7i4wFwuAZuzQdH3G03zYw.text: The cocktails were creative and yummy.  There were 6 of us, service was top notch, we had fajitas, salmon, enchiladas, habanero shrimp.  All was fresh and delicious.  I especially enjoyed the guacamole.  We all recommend!

sW3o5dDzXCvPF6XfrwXx2A.text: Great food and drinks! All of the staff were very warm and friendly and helpful. Our server gave us the best service and was always checking in on our table. We will be back!!!

9Ew_VMOEi85CijGHMCQ2mw.text: Service was pretty good, food was below average. GREEN salsa was good, quesadilla was great, fajitas were very small and lacking flavor, for 2 adults, 1 child. $163!! Was not even decent. Overall, huge thumbs down!

LT9-0dLmAmamNPF3WGyY4Q.text: Restaurant itself is absolutely beautiful but the food does not match up. Small portions, salty chicken, and tough fried octopus. Margarita was good and waitstaff was somewhat pleasant one of the bartenders not so much she acted like she was too cool to be there and had somewhere else she would rather be. Not worth the $90 I spent and  unfortunately as a local resident I will not be revisiting or suggesting this to place to others.

iLjmHa8Z4VAZGblCTOFN2A.text: Had lunch here and am only mildly impressed. I got 2 cheese enchiladas with rice and beans and veggies. The food was very good, but the teeniest portions. Enchiladas were made with corn street taco sized tortillas! I'd say 1/3 cup rice, 1/3 cup beans, 1tbsp guacamole. For $14. Not worth it at all.  My entire party usually only comes here to drink so maybe that's what this place is really for. I won't be returning.

BZz4WhMY13eSWjtoTe5GTQ.text: Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina located in the Hughes Center. Frontage on flamingo just between Koval & Paradise. The art work and decor gives a cool vibe ! There's a couple things I might change ! Still a cool looking spot overall.  Being from a family full of Mexican food chefs and restaurant owners from Mexico , we can tend to be a little picky. Had to bring my mom in to give this place a second chance since she didn't care for her first experience.  She ordered the Baja fish tacos the 2nd time around and she was satisfied. Woohoo! Lol.   I ordered the carnitas enchiladas with salsa verde crema Which I did enjoy. They actually prepare the enchiladas and add the protein on top of the enchilada which I thought was different. I actually think I'd prefer it that way now!   There's a few things on the menu I'd like to come back and try but i come here during lunch hours on lunch break . Perhaps on a Tuesday I can come back at happy hour for taco Tuesday as tacos are 50% off.  There are a couple of recommendations id like to make in-regards to the food ingredients/taste etc.   I am not a fan of the salsa. We make salsa at home weekly. I know not everyone likes it the way I do however these salsas not only are way too mild and had no kick at all (I don't mind mild salsa at all) but these salsas were sweet tasting. When I don't finish all of the chips and salsa you know something is off for me. Perhaps offer something with a little more kick or even a little spice?  In addition I noticed the same type of consistency in flavor with the rice and beans. It almost had a sweet taste to them as well. Now that i think about it if i could id just ordered the enchiladas alacart or just minus the rice and beans (I love rice n beans tho!) and keep the 3rd side they do offer like roasted veggies or corn. I did enjoy the complimentary guacamole upon check in. The place wasn't too packed and the service was good. I'm giving this place the benefit of the doubt by giving them 4 stars . I think it has good potential . Hopefully I can get back in here and try some cocktails and other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RhrFzYBghg8uzkwKy2OwxQ.text: From the hostess, to the server, the food, and the entertainment, our party had a fantastic experience. I recommend the ceviche and the octopus as appetizers. The green salsa is on point as well! The food is on the smaller side, but surprisingly filling. The asada tacos and corn were stand outs on our entree plates. I will definitely be back again!

vIsmmtJ4rghkIHutVxkOuA.text: Overpriced non authentic Mexican food. It's a cute spot. The interior decor is really nice. It's small. I like the music ambiance. There wasn't many people when I went for dinner. Granted it was week day. The drinks were pretty good. But the food... not impressed at all. I had ceviche. Just didn't wow me. Service was just okay.

NH1DiSfRsPymyn0HvWMQxw.text: Had a new menu item today, it was amazing! The chef came out to see if I liked the way he cooked it and the service was amazing! Ambiance is great, I'll be eating here again!

iK3MrCmIpe2blpYjnhGCHQ.text: Well, I was with a few other people and somehow it was decided that we wanted mexican food. Luckily we ended up here! It was walking distance from where we were staying. I had no idea it would be an awesome unique food experience!  As we walked up a handsome employee opened the door for us, and I was very impressed. I assumed he was a manager, but he turned out to be our waiter. Oh boy, this man was awesome! He put up with so much from our group. One person didn't like their drink because they were unfamiliar with ginger beer, he was super sweet about that and it wasn't a problem. Then they wanted enchiladas but the sauce choices were tough to decide. Our wonderful waiter brought out decent sized cups of every one of the sauces for all of us to try! Well, that sold the enchiladas for me. I loved the one sauce he recommended so much I just went with everything he said he would order and I was not disappointed. Now the only thing that is a bummer, I do not know his name. But I know one person from our group went out of her way to tell the manager that he deserved a raise and that's the truth. He made our visit memorable and went above and beyond. I was happy I got a separate check so that he could be tipped super well.  Thanks! I hope to return someday with the hubby!

ayUZwwghGpChrMcakV6K_Q.text: Food and service was very good. My friend and I appreciated the unique menu and atmosphere.  The prices were slightly high but it was a nice evening.

dvlxbBGxABR_M7fTc94SIg.text: My mom and I had dinner here on a Friday night before seeing a show.  Our server was great!  He was extremely friendly and honest about his food preferences.  We ordered the guacamole to start (which we got for free for checkin' in)!  We also both got margaritas on the rocks ($9 each).  They were delicious! And strong (that's always a win).  I ordered the brick pressed roasted chicken which was pretty tasty.  It had roasted vegetables, potatoes al pastor, pickled fennel, guajillo, and chicken thyme jus.  My mom had the tacos al pastor, which she also really liked.  This came with manchego cheese, white onion, and pineapple. It also came with corn, beans, and rice.    Our bill for the both of us came out to around $60 - not too bad.  We absolutely loved the decor!! Beautiful restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al pastor
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iDGCDptIpLtHAMqaKd5IHQ.text: A must when in Vegas. Great food, service and atmosphere. Class act. Niki was a great ambassador for the place

Jqu0GgujvtaYK0L_Coy-4Q.text: Modern hip and delicious Mexican food. Great for family or a romantic date. Pretty decent location away from the strip so it's not too busy with tourist acting a fool.

z5dapJ28aa3hhpp6bcrsxg.text: Went to Bandito's for a birthday dinner and unfortunately this place just misses the mark. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere, but the food is far from delicious, and having to wait over an hour for tacos is insane. Don't be fooled by the Vegas hype. Every new restaurant, eatery, or coffee shop in Las Vegas is the best didn't you know?

xfiyugCzWRUQLz67Gl4Xtg.text: Not much food to choose from for dinner, over priced and nothing to rave about....  Server was trying too hard to be funny, and even poking at one of our friends throughout the evening when he clearly wasn't playing along with it.  The space is cool, but it's reaching to be "fancy" for something that looks like it used to be a Chipotle.   Went to Bonito Michoacan Mexican Restaurant the next day for lunch, had a WAY better experience and the food was better

l5n88ozaDp4YZBnRjErGbw.text: Stopped in with colleagues after trade show break down , great cocktails inventive menu fresh ingredients all choices were great and not huge portions. Service was also very good. Nice because this location is NOT in a mega casino.

6W0Vq_TihRv4qUiDORgKNA.text: The good: Restaurant was big and airy, our waitress was great, happy hour included appetizers for half off. We ordered the queso, ceviche, flautas, sope sampler, a margarita and a lemonade and our bill was $35 - pretty good price. My recommendations: queso and sope sampler.   The not so good: the ceviche was bland and the flautas were ok. We had our daughter (who is under 1) with us and she was trying to interact with everyone including all the employees and the bartender made a stupid snide comment about her hair and how she needed a haircut. Not cool, dude. Not cool.   I hope the manager reads this and trains their staff that snide comments need to be kept to themselves and are not needed.

BIN11-CbzsP1Z7ZmOHqWzA.text: Happy hour just got a whole lot better!   First thing you'll notice about Bandito is how beautiful it is, the art and decor are so nice, you WANT to sit here and eat. Then get ready to hear some nice music, the atmosphere is set.  I've been here a few times, if you go alone I recommend sitting at the bar. They've got some top notch bartending going on!   First things first, the BARBACOA Michelada is the best damn Michelada in Vegas...the spice used to salt the rim and make the chelada are perfect! Not too spicy, but not bland, then some genius decided to put a chunk of barbacoa on top of this. Muchas gracias!   FOOD:   Be bold! Get the pulpo fritto (fried octopus)! Its It's fried calamari, definitely marinated in lime which I love, and not over cooked. I then recommend the sopes, I was pleasantly surprised with veggie sopes and obviously the barbacoa one is killer, not too crazy about the sweet pork, reminds me of Cafe Rios a bit.  Guacamole and queso fundido is average, not that much guacamole or flavor compared to say a Lindo Michoacan or Segundo Sol.  Tacos here are also decent, I'm gonna say the best meat here is the barbacoa because the flavor and tenderness are so perfected.   Customer Service:  The staff here is great, they make sure you have all you need and more. Took my coworkers once and the waitor was friendly and they loved the place because of the service.   Overall I'm glad Bandito is here in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful art!
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamale Trio (sauce was not good in my opinion)
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbacoa Michelada is a MUST!

gByklsXx7bHzsev-PxxTAA.text: I ordered the ceviche appetizer and chicken and carne asada tacos. Everything was amazingly delicious. Flavorful, tender, juicy, and all with unique flavored sauce that was complementary to the dish (not overwhelming). I highly recommend the corn as your 3rd side dish!

rpX6_J13RBDWaQ26q_Gdbw.text: Very cool vibe as you walk in.  Staff is terrific, we asked for a table near TV to watch the game, they put us in the right spot.  Waitress guided us through the menu, answered every question and was not afraid to suggest things.  Margaritas were very tasty.  The guacamole was fresh, could have been a bit spicer for our taste.  Dinner choices were many and all of us were very happy with the taste, preparation and quantity.

nY-VCE6uk4Uv85RSRVw4zg.text: We hosted our wedding brunch at Bandito for a group of 20 and had an absolutely wonderful experience.  The service was outstanding and the food and drinks were delicious.

bqvq3y7bKgg68coIpOGeMw.text: Awesome atmosphere and great food.  Ask for Stacey...  She's a cutie with a booty who keeps the beer flowing until you yell "STOP!"

-3ydKnVQ7yG4MVLv95YzPw.text: As a professional woman I expect exemplary service when I patronage an establishment. Our service was good by our guest services agent however as a group of 10 we were approached by the owner and our bill was "reviewed" to examine the amount of money netwe'd spent during the course of our meal. We live in a time when we continue to experience the subtle hints of unfounded discrimination. The food was decent, the service by our waitress was good however the owner made it very clear that our group of minorities was unwelcome in his establishment. Make no mistake, I speak with my dollars and I will not be returning the this business in the future. Far too many places to spend my money in Las Vegas, Bandito's will never get another one of my dollars...shame on you!

qV2BCJTj3x1bvWSZf7cz1A.text: Best experience I've ever had.  Went there a couple weeks ago. The food is AMAZING. So is the service.  Will definitely be returning.

kwZf2tzBOufHPrzpB5jxLg.text: Our first time here and it was excellent! We had the Habanero shrimp with carne asada and the turkey salad. Both were excellent! Everyone was very attentive and were checked on often. I would highly recommend this restaurant when visiting Vegas. We'll be back for sure.

b2ub7Lo6uU-pod2rrl94ZA.text: This Happy Hour menu is one of my favorites! The staff here are all incredibly friendly and great at their jobs. I continue to come back because of the staff more than anything else (but the food is fantastic too!). If I had to change one thing, I'd ask them too add some more wine to their Happy Hour selections OR a hard cider for those of us who can't drink beer. Otherwise, the house Pinot isn't bad and their chips and salsa never disappoint.

s-AUD_u3BYzHVA83tidkFg.text: Every month or so myself and a small group of professionals enjoy each others company during happy hour throughout our fine city.  Never once have we ever been approached about our vernacular, tone, or had the amount of our bill questioned.  The food was decent, our waitress Paloma was great, but unfortunately the owner killed the vibe and made us more aware that he was a bit uneasy with a table of 10 of a very diverse professional crowd that happen to be of color.  The more insulting moment was when our bill of nearly $600 was "reviewed" and questioned.  Needless to say; we were ripped off and not provided the 1/2 off happy hour special.  Unfortunately Banditos will never see another dollar from my self and the other nine patrons I was with as well as NEVER receive a recommendation.  Banditos should do and be better.

v2y1C2F_nE6W-CVCDduG6Q.text: Love love love this place. The food is fresh and delicious. The service is impeccable. Highly recommend. Free parking.

bbzdhBpHGqq-7nuxNbXx-Q.text: We were in town visiting and decided to try something off the strip. We found Bandito and made reservations.  The place has really cool decor and a nice ambience. We were seated immediately and the host was very friendly.  The menu looked amazing. I had the halibut enchiladas and my husband had the plancha with steak and shrimp. As an app we had the chicken quesadilla.  Our waiter Carlos was so nice and very attentive. It seemed like he was waiting all the tables at the restaurant but was moving quickly and getting around to all of them. We loved the food and service here. We would definitely come back.

N-WQGj3MbfngufTZJWlsAA.text: First experience and will Definitely return again! Wonderful atmosphere, service, marvelous cocktails  and menu.

SSezwUGbszS43EeAQ2QlVg.text: This is a nice intimate setting. Very well decorated. The food was good. I was quite surprised they at a turkey taco salad on the menu. Healthy eating. It was a bit pricey before happy hour.  TVs are on the sports channel. Nice. I would revisit

oKBY5bjBaKD5By3Z8bxrLw.text: Overpriced and low quality food! My margarita had salt all over the glass as well. Went on a Friday night thinking it was going to be packed..not at all. Save your $ and go elsewhere

rMY2cUF9C2vTh99-snekYA.text: I had the BEST jalapeno margarita there last night! Staff is super helpful & friendly.  Habenero Shrimp is to die for. Ambience is perfection, especially with the live Spanish guitar. I'll be traveling from the southwest to this place again in the near future. Worth the drive, get over there already.

V2X7z10RpKggAECUogx1rw.text: Great service and even better food! Margaritas were awesome and you can't beat their happy hour!

2SGtGkmsL00H2sXdHAoh9Q.text: Had the combination plate for 15$ and was not impressed at all. The flavors were mediocre at best. The meat portion was below average, literally had one small sliver of meat on the small enchilada. Why even advertise meat on the plate description when your only providing a sample size piece of meat. The taco was drenched in some salsa, and again the meat was non-existent in the taco. The tamale was flavorless, only tasted the salsa it was saturated in. Overall, this place is an overpriced Mexican restaurant for no reason other than it's location. I understand you have higher rent but come on your customers should feel satisfied after spending 15$ on a combination plate. What a disgrace of a combination plate. You should call your combination plate more of a sampler and put some toothpicks on the three small items provided.  Keep this up and your fate may be like the other business located next to you - out of business.

uQg-PqhBn63OgLNC0tYODw.text: Just moved to the neighborhood and stumbled into Bandito. Beautifully set up restaurant with delicious food. Easily my new neighborhood gem. Just off the strip but still mostly locals it seemed like. Great food and margs.

7u1gTRvk1wZB4XYD7QNnHQ.text: I love this place and I would go back another round any day and the food is amazing and amazing service and the people out there

Nl0uuoDtyP7LNqsJwxQu0A.text: Our server's name was Jared, he was so nice and helped us decide on what to order. The food here is so good I really recommend it. The place is cozy and I love the vibe.. I can't wait to come back

IzvqRi39s3uG9-l98Lnzdw.text: Excellent food.  Even my picky teenager who typically doesn't like Mexican/Latin food (he's Chinese) really wants to go back.  Can't wait to go back for date night.

csPWh2WuzHitnXHAgcT7kQ.text: Quite ordinary and uninspired "gringo" Mexican food. The service was great but the food left much to be desired. The atmosphere was clean and bright.  We were completely underwhelmed with the food. 4 stars for the service and 2 stars for the food.

5OWWUCrguq-KgsJbDxwHlw.text: The decor at Bandito is stylish modern, open and comfortable. The service is friendly, attentive, quick and responsive. The three rating is based on our server Amanda's performance.  We attended Bandito during a media event and decided to use the opportunity to get a good sampling of foods and drinks.  Bandito is a fusion/modern mexican/Latin restaurant in the vein of Border Grill and Mesa Grill.    We started off or I should say we should have started with appetizers but most everything came at once (the soup came five minutes latter).  The Queso Bandito was one of the best I've had, quality cheese well prepared, but at most places, traditional and fusion, it would have  come with tortillas.  The fried octopus was one of the worst dishes I've sampled. The octopus was tough, lukewarm, and bland. The chicken tortilla soup had a strange thick chipotle like broth. The soup like most of dishes we sampled was attractively plated but not satisfying in any way.    The main dishes were not much better, my wife had the habenero shrimp and carne asada and I had the special-barbacoa nachos. The shrimp were well cooked, but the carne asada was tough and chewy. The barbacoa nachos was great looking but very disappointing dish. The chips, cheese, beans, and pico were tasty but barely there. The brisket barbacoa was tough, stringy, and dry and there were mounds of it on the dish. This is the first time I wish a nacho dish came with less meat. The meat reminded me of Cuban ropa vieja, but not nearly as tasty.  Barbacoa in quality traditional and fusion restaurants is braised or slow roasted and grilled-using beef cheeks or ribeye cuts. Barbacoa should be succulent, tasty, and fatty in great naughty way. The Bandito barbacoa was not even close. I had high hopes for Bandito based on the ambiance and attentive service but was greatly disappointed.  On up side the drinks and the queso were excellent so we may be back for happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great looking food, the taste was just not there

B4C34oQ9TJKU5oJX-PD69Q.text: What a great find off the strip. Jose was a great server and the food was excellent! Recommend the margaritas

bG8fx3FfAsE7k95JLOxjBQ.text: Excellent Mexican fusion food... If you are in the market for some delicious Margaritas and excellent tacos, gotta try to place.   Great service and contemporary atmosphere.  Highly recommend this restaurant... Also nice to bring dates.

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open kitchen
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great live music

nb9YZYjZ-ppwvOu2UCY0wQ.text: Trendy restaurant serving classic Mexican dishes with a twist, but actually delivers on flavor is how I would describe Bandito. I stopped by for dinner and was able to grab a seat before the real dinner rush came it. Right when you walk in, you will see a little luche libre wrestler by the hostess table.   The atmosphere here is industrial chic with a warm bright Latin wall mural by the back. The restaurant is upscale enough for a nice outing, but not too good for a pair of casual jeans and flip flops. It was already busy when I went in the evening, but service was prompt. The watermelon mint agua fresca was refreshing. The cup was not as big as I would have liked it, but that's ok. The cup was rimmed with salt which was a first for me for agua fresca. Still tasty. The steak was very flavorful and the elote was an easy favorite. I think the chef did a good job of just seasoning all of the food without salting everything and using chili peppers and herbs to bring out the flavor of the meat, the rice, and even the guacamole. Be sure to try the churro with the dulce de leche ice cream! It's a great way to wrap up a flavorful meal here. Will be back!

6rsnr-sgk9GTTDNmJpU0iA.text: My husband and I recently enjoyed lunch here and we were very impressed with the food, ambiance, and service.   Since it was a hot day we started with a couple of the Agua Frescas and found them to be very refreshing. The Tamale Trio was our shared starter and that was delicious. The complimentary chips were good. We loved both the red and green salsa that were served with the chips.  I went with Carnitas Tacos as my entree and loved the flavors on the tacos. The orange glaze on the meat added a great flavor. The beans and rice on the side were tasty. For my third side I chose Mexican Street Corn and enjoyed that as well. The tacos were loaded with meat, but sides were on the smaller side. I loved the overall portion of the meal and thought it helped me avoid going overboard. My husband had the Turkey Chorizo Torta and loved it.  When dessert time came around we were told that the only dessert was a brownie. My husband is weird and doesn't eat chocolate in the form of brownie or cake so we had to pass. The waitress returned soon after with an amazing cheesecake made with serrano peppers and topped with a strawberry watermelon salsa. There was a nice caramel drizzle on the plate. It's a dessert that the restaurant is testing to possibly add to the menu. I thought it was so nice of them to bring this out since I love my desserts and was sad to have to decline the brownie option. The cheesecake was amazing too! I really hope to see this become part of the regular dessert menu. The cheesecake had an excellent flavor and the peppers inside added a nice heat that wasn't overwhelming. The fruity salsa really balanced the heat and the caramel was delicious.  Our waitress was attentive and everything we ordered was delivered to the table without a long wait. The manager, I believe his name was Julian, checked in on us several times. He wanted to make sure that everything was great with both food and service. They were both great and I really couldn't think of anything to suggest that could improve our experience!  We'll definitely be back and I hope to see the cheesecake on the menu!

RZLw4AIEhnp1J4s8FEEGhQ.text: Bandito's gorgeous black-and-red space is located just off the Strip, with a sweet Happy Hour deal from 4:30-6:30 featuring half off apps and $5 margs.  Recently came in with a group to try a bunch of dishes, and I'm looking forward to going back to try a few more.   The chicken flautas were one of my favorite dishes, with a mild dipping sauce and a flavorful filling. The nachos are served as a giant mountain and worth the upcharge to add protein- the asada was nicely soft but I also liked how juicy the carnitas was without sacrificing crispiness! The quesadillas were also a hit at our table, and the ceviche impressed in that what we initially thought were pieces of giant Peruvian corn were actually scallops. I will do some shady shit for nacho cheese, and I was disappointed to find that the queso fundido was thin and lacked flavor. I'm not much of a drinker but I appreciated that the $5 margs were a full glass rather than the smaller pours I've seen elsewhere. They were out of the octopus when we went, so I'll definitely be returning to give that a shot along with the sope sampler.

TJQ4DfW0GyZMyd3eovwBKQ.text: A decent meal. The meal started with complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa was fresh and the chips very crisp.   I ordered the enchiladas al pastor. The pork atop the tortillas was tough. The classic enchilada sauce tasted primarily of tomato paste. The tortillas were nicely soft and slightly chewy. Inside was just cheese, which sort of made them eat like blintzes.   The charred corn side was smokey, starchy, and properly seasoned.   The beans and rice were just there. They were OK, but didn't pack any interesting flavor profile.   Overall, while the service was excellent, I thought the food was just OK.

_08XM_m_xmj95r-EG5xDBA.text: Came here last evening to check out the HH (4:30pm to 6:30pm) with some of the local Yelp/Instagram/foodie friends. Thanks Nikki (aka @misohungry_vegas) for taking the initiative to organize this casual get together. I probably would still be in the dark about this new restaurant on E. Flamingo (between Lawry's The Prime Rib and McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks), waiting for Yelp to alert me to this hot new restaurant.  The restaurant's high ceiling, the huge murals, the open kitchen design, centrally-accessible well-stocked bar, lots of exterior floor-to-ceiling glass windows with natural lighting for that natural lighting all food bloggers love, yeah, the decor and interior design of the restaurant are amazing. The restaurant signage out front almost felt too subtle, at least during the day time.  Anyway, yesterday was another scorcher just like the preceding EDC weekend, except it was a few degrees warmer in the open oven we called Summer in Las Vegas. So in spite of having the car AC on full blast, I was quickly wilting away on the drive over and was very appreciative of Bandito's demonstration of the marvels of industrial air conditioning, essential to survival in this present state of daily excessive heat warning.  So once we were inside and greeted warmly by the host, who walked us over to our table, our waitress introduced herself and recommended their Bandito Margarita (just $5 during HH), which we both declined. Sorry, not a drinker. But the ones our friends ordered when they arrived shortly looks great in those colorfully sparkly glasses it was served in. They liked it and all opted for a second round.  As far as our food order, we ordered from their HH special (1/2 off appetizers), and the only item we wanted to try but didn't order was the octopus (86 from the menu for the night since the quality did not meet the chef's standard).  Queso Bandito ($4 HH). Pretty cheesy, but we failed at our attempted cheese porn. When it was dropped off at our table, the cheese was really hot making it way too runny, so it thwarted our effort to contribute to the hashtag meltedcheese, hashtag cheeseporn, hashtag cheesepull communities. But the caramelized part on the edges are extra yummy.  Chicken Flautas was a solid hit ($6 HH). The five of us easily K.O. this fried appetizer, the way Samuel Peter KO Jeremy Williams in the second round of their 2004 NABF title match. Poor Flautas.  My personal favorite is the cheesy Chicken Quesadilla ($6 HH). Every Mexican restaurant serves it, but not many does it the way Bandito's does it. And as a public service announcement for all the food bloggers even thinking about getting that perfect melted cheese porn action for their social media account and their followers viewing pleasure, let me just remind you of that popular and over used phrase "No pain, no gain."  Guacamole ($4). You get a sizable mound of it on a small dish. It was good. I would have loved to be able to order this while mindlessly chipping away at it with the complimentary chips and salsas, while watching the 2017 NBA Finals! #Dubnation!!!  But we ordered a lot of food and some came with guacamole too, so surprisingly the guacamole survived all 10 rounds. There was even a tablespoon worth left on the plate, since everyone was too polite to finish it.  Seafood Ceviche ($6 HH). Beautifully presented with the shrimp, baby scallops, white fish forming a small mound topped with its garnishes. It is a simple and refreshing dish to eat in this heat, but the simple plate of seafood makes for a surprisingly challenging subject to photograph. Just imagine if there is a gallery that have all the photos ever taken throughout the entirety of time of just Bandito's Seafood Ceviche, it would be pretty easy to identify who has either the talent or skill of a photographer, and it would be interesting to see how the really good ones frame and shot their picts. Wow, that was totally random :p  Let's see we also ordered a Nacho ($5 HH), with a Carne Asada add-on (extra $4). There was a mix up and we ended up with a Carnitas one as well. The nachos are huge and definitely meant for sharing. But you certainly can order it all for yourself if that's  your thing, in which case I would definitely get the guacamole plus add on a protein and really make it a meal. Needless to say, we failed to slay the nacho dragons.  The group's HH get together was wallet friendly too. The total bill was only $70, that's including 6 Bandito's Margaritas (HH). Perfect for a cheap Tinder date, which I wouldn't know anything about since I refuse to be forced to sign up witching FB (even a fake one just for all the annoying apps on the FB authentication bandwagon).  I shall end this 4 star review here, since there are plenty of TMI inserted in the review already.  Stay hydrated, don't give the excessive heat a chance to score that KO my friends! And watch out for one another. Hashtag TheEnd

0cCGquLEckoKn0WQ3zHZUA.text: Found this gem while vacationing in Vegas. Close to the strip like 5-10 minute drive and all I can say is, well worth it! Gorgeous venue, comfortable seating and with a romantic vibe. Great date spot! I brought my family in however as we all were vacationing together and they have a killer happy hour and it was also taco Tuesday! Best of both worlds! We had queso served with warm tortillas, hand made fresh guacamole, chips n salsas with green and red salsas. My mom is vegan and the chef even personally came out to see if he could accommodate any of her needs! Wow! That is fantastic service. The owner Kent was making rounds and stopped by to ensure everything was fantastic and we were happy to report it was! Our server, Edgar, was amazing. Flawless service, answered all our questions and gave us the right amount of space to just relax and enjoy with family. The service staff was on point with refills for chips/ salsas, my dad's sodas, and our margarita glasses were never empty (as we requested). This goes down as my new favorite restaurant when I stop in Vegas and would highly recommend this restaurant to all! Happy hour is 4:30-6:30 daily. Oh, dessert was outstanding as well. Churros, as simple as they seem, are difficult to get perfect and ours were perfection. Thanks Kent and your excellent staff for the best dinner we had out to eat alll week! Can't wait to come back :)

1bHKaN-6_MpqyQn-gkkG3g.text: Came with a group of 18 for Happy Hour, they were very accommodating every time I called re: the reservation and when we arrived, flexible on seating and attentive on service. Had the Fried Octopus and it was fantastic! Will definitely return here very soon, easy access and great location too!

GfOWWiGzz7dY_yMs19jszg.text: I came here for Happy Hour on a Tuesday with my friends and was very excited to finally try this spot. I haven't heard much about it but the decor and atmosphere looked great when i walked in. My friends and i ordered margaritas ($5 for HH is a steal.. and they were strong) then we proceeded to look at their food menu. The server told us that all the appetizers were half off during HH (also a great deal being that their prices were a bit high for Mexican food). So...I ordered the fried octopus, ceviche, and chips and salsa. My friends ordered guac, nachos and sopas. *Note: they do not have any taco specials for taco Tuesdays. (Update: So apparently they do have a Taco Tuesday special...however our server didn't mention anything about it. Wish I knew!)  Let's start with my fried octopus... turns out it was NOT octopus. I grabbed a big piece and cut it in half and thought it didn't look like octopus. I took a bite of the half i had cut off and guess what...? it was chicken (texture and flavor of chicken breast, not octopus-if you've eaten octopus before, you'd know that it has a chewy yet tender texture). I had my friend try a piece as well and she also confirmed that it was a piece of chicken. I couldn't believe that this overly fried, almost burnt tasting piece of "octopus" was a chicken nugget. For the record, I've had octopus many times in different ways.. grilled, fried, raw, etc. I immediately told my server and without any explanation or reassurance, he apologized and took it away. Now my ceviche was good (it was on the sweeter side because of the mangoes but it was tasty), along with my chips and salsa which was fresh. The server even brought out their habanero salsa which was so delicious(super spicy but flavorful). The guac was average and the nachos were very sad looking (very plain and boring with minimal toppings). The sopas were good but the protein (carnitas & carne Asada) on them were small.   Overall, the margaritas were nice and strong, the habanero salsa was my favorite, and the server was attentive and kind. Besides that, the portions for HH is extremely sad. It just felt very pretentious because you can tell that the portions were definitely "HH portions". I'm pretty disappointed at the fact that they served me "fried octopus" when in fact they were friend little pieces of chicken. I honestly feel tricked.. I don't know if they ran out of octopus or what but they could've just 86'd the item and save us the trouble. The server was kind enough to take it off my check but a manager never came to the table to apologize or explain/justify the fried faux octopus. I don't think I'd come back to Bandito.. but if it did, I'd only get a margarita and chips/salsa anyways which means i can go to any other Mexican restaurant with better prices and portions.

WIw_cABRR4lRHPydyeoABg.text: Moved into the area a couple months ago and would see all the lights from this beautiful place twinkling night after night as I drive by. We finally decided to try it and we were not disappointed. The service was great and the food...so good. We shared they cheese enchiladas and they were great. We also had the brownie dessert and it was delicious!   Highlights: Queso- You have to try this! It so yummy and it's half off during happy hour.  Street Corn- Omg this stuff is amazing!   My hubby and I actually came here on aFriday night and I came back the very next night with my daughter. When my hubby found out where we were he had me bring food home to him as well!

YYNgrxRRRAlttEormcYMaw.text: I'm saying this as a public service announcement.   Come here now. Location is just off the strip so you can get away from it all with a simple jaunt down flamingo ... the ambience/decor is a breath of fresh air after being in the contrived casinos. Ok... but now the important part. Food.  I love Austin tacos. Love them. Soooo.... that said... we went with the triple taco plate. Carne asada... Al pastor...and the barbacoa. Next level guys. And we drank the house bandito sauce. Haven't had anything approaching an AUSTIN taco anywhere but Banditos here in  Las Vegas.   As we came in, Kent the owner walked around to show us the spray painted murals and just sat for a moment to talk about his approach to putting all this together. It was refreshing. You can tell this is a team here, Our waitress Jessica is just a great human and you can tell they all care about their restaurant experience they serve up.   Love it when you find a place like this!!  I wonder if I could snag an Airbnb within walking distance for the next conference in Vegas.

1sp7zGG5G-b1VaVRa6VU7w.text: AWESOME!!!!  The best Mexican food I've ever eaten and I eat Mexican at least once a week.  The food is amazing and the staff is super friendly.  This is a must go to place in Las Vegas.

cyPEtEztfbTtQsz2yoK3xg.text: Um this meal was fantastic! We went for lunch and albeit a little pricey, I feel like it was entirely worth it ! Used the check in offer to get free chips and guac. The guac was tasty. They also bring two types of salsa to the table once you're seated. A red and a green, both were really good, and I'm not sure which one I liked more. I started with the la pinta marg and it did not disappoint !  Super smooth and not too sweet. My dining companion ordered the steak Torta with potatoes al pastor as her side. Both were DELICIOUS! The potatoes are cooked with pineapple and have an amazing semi spicy sauce on them! With the help of our waitress, I selected the carne asada burrito, fried, and topped with a blood orange habanero sauce as my entree. Street corn off the cob was my choice of side. Again both were fantastic. The burrito was loaded with carne asada, and the sauce had so much depth of flavor! The street corn was insane ! My only complaint was that it was such a small portion, I could've eaten double the portion ! Overall this place is pretty cool. Well decorated. Friendly service. And the food is BOMB.

cw8gWzQwhvQ8aobhZsN1jw.text: What an excellent experience in gastro-opulence and patron-focused service. My friends/ colleagues and I are in town for a review course at The Tuscany and had 45 minutes for lunch.  We stumbled upon this delight and were immediately enchanted by the good vibes, music, and decor of this establishment.  The hostess greeted us heartily and seated us outside upon our request, ensuring that our table was clean.  Our waiter greeted us with ice waters and scrumptious chips and salsa.  We basked in the sun and niches through 2 baskets of the chips and dip to which they asked if we would like a third. Only one (out of three) of us rightfully declined.    Our food followed soon after, and, unfortunately, one of our orders was incorrect. We didn't have time to re-order so had it removed from the bill. I can say that my order was a bit wrong, but absolutely delicious. I devoured the burrito with veggies and the mole rojo sauce.  The owner can out to apologize for the wrong order, offering by to remake it on the House. That is superb service. No one was upset or looking for a free meal. I offered half my burrito (using mostly pantomiming because my mouth was always full).  But the team at this restaurant saw to ensuring that our experience in their restaurant be excellent. Can't wait to go here again.

ovKhg1k27aoQgwm6o-N5Mw.text: Pricey but worth it. Really strong drinks and the pastor tacos are amazing great service. Was slow when I dined but it was a Monday afternoon

pYbS-f6Gn05-n02KgX7GjQ.text: Amazing on so many levels. The wait staff was so attentive. They were friendly and took care of us really well. We had the chicken plate and the carnitas tacos. Both were great. The chicken was tender with a nice crisp on the outside and the veggies that came with it were to die for. Carnitas were juicy! Yum.   The vibey ambiance rounded this off to be one good dinner!

k-7rvPZmeQb_GneN2wbFLg.text: The food was DELICIOUS!! I had the barbacoa tacos & my Husband had the shrimp & Skirt steak!! Not only was the food DELICIOUS but our Waiter, Jose was AWESOME!! YOU wont be disappointed!

h2I0keNERIZchc3XBPIGOQ.text: Great ambiance, gives a authentic but modern vibe. First time seeing such a unique and appealing design. QBViGXFEiLsvfEBwh0pF0w.text: The food is nothing to rave about... the portions are very small and the presentation of food is even worse. The drinks were the only thing worth the prices. We gave it a try to try something new. I think the food is very over priced for what you get. It also took an extremely long rime to get anything we ordered, including desert. The restaurant itself is very nicely decorated, but I feel that is what you're paying for... will not be returning.

y11a3044VG5MxnWS7LM5Dg.text: I'm sorry but the food  took an absolutely, ridiculous, amount of time to come out. I gave this place a chance twice just to see if that was a one time thing, but it wasn't.   Food: Asada tacos: 2/5 Carnita tacos: 3/5 Beef tacos: 3/5 Chicken tacos: 1/5 Chips and salsa: 4/5

DXx8mCSDYfF0A6TDUm4urw.text: This place is great! Came in here for their happy hour the other day and it was definitely tasty.  First, we arrived at 4pm and their happy hour doesn't start till 4:30, so I was surprised when our waitress said she'd give us the happy hour deals anyway-- Score!  I immediately checked in on Yelp and got some free guacamole-- Double Score!  We ordered a beer and a margarita for $5 each, and started off with our guacamole, some queso, chips and salsa.  The queso is big. Very good, but also very large and heavy. I'd recommend only ordering this if you're looking for a gut-buster and have more than 2 people... this will fill you up.  Sopes- We ordered the appetizer sopes, which had 2 beef, 2 carnitas, and 2 veggies. The veggies were just ok, but the carnitas and beef were outstanding.  Tamales- Almost the same, one beef (huge tamales, cut in half), one carnitas and one cheese. My boyfriend loved them. He said they could have used a little more meat and sauce, but they were great. I ate a little bit of each, but I've never really loved tamales, so my opinion isn't nearly as valuable if you're looking for whether or not they're solid.  The Mexican street style corn- An absolute MUST. You're tastebuds will thank you. The corn isn't nearly as heavy as some of the street corn I've had in the past (loaded with mayo). Their corn almost has a creme fraiche style sauce and is creamy, tasty and I'd take it home to mom and marry it.  This place is solid. I'll definitely be coming back again!

83NB_bGRRJe3BNwavSeC5Q.text: This is such an amazing restaurant. Love the atmosphere, food is incredible and staff are friendly and efficient.  Leave room for dessert--  my personal favorite is the pineapple upside down cake but I will be going back soon to try the cheesecake (which I hear is amazing) I promise you will be back. I went there on a Tuesday and came back on Saturday.

vblaWUAQdAIq-FX_PWqogQ.text: This place was amazing!!  Jose was the best server and made us feel so welcomed.  Great drinks and good Mexican food.

gkyZuHLyDBemsm6j45jH9Q.text: High end Mexican fushion type of restaurant. They drinks were great and food was good but prices a little too high.

H5nEhK3xqEAaVO4wazba-g.text: If your in Las Vegas and want a relaxing dinner try this place. Great service and food. Try there Sandia( watermelon )margarita:) and octopus appetizer.

WIq_xfk4HdRawZwiU6QdGg.text: The food was alright! Nothing that I would write home about. The server was nice and it was a really beautiful setting.

ckeYb8Oj7WCnhrIaicIsQA.text: Went to dinner with a few friends and everything was good but the service. Suzanne's service was the worst we've had. Made asking for a glass of water to getting our check split felt like an inconvenience. Rolled her eyes and gave attitude when asked for a glass with our beers. Not to mention we had a pretty easy going 6 top on what seemed like a slower day. The price for my girlfriend and I was not worth the bad service.

A3zAvEfS4_k7bboG8Yh3hg.text: We dined here tonight after searching Google for good Mexican fare in Las Vegas.  I ordered the Chicken Mole and it was absolutely delicious.  Flavourful, hot and plated to perfection.  The chips came with green and red salsas and we were told they pride themselves on homemade salsa.  They offered us a "hotter version" as well which was a nice touch.  Thank you for an amazing dinner.  We will be back before we leave Vegas.  Our meals were nothing short of perfect.

EN1btXrjNN-7Ip6tBNqTKg.text: Stopped in for an appetizer. The patio is dog friendly which is always a plus for me & my fur baby. They also brought my dog a special little tasting. We ordered the chicken flautas. Very tasty. Came with 2 sauces. A red one & a jalapeno verde. Verde was the stand out for me!  Service was great! Definitely would return.

qF-s___vxhXUOzEa7fS98g.text: I have to be honest...I wasn't expecting much. SO, what a pleasant surprise to have some pretty fantastic food.  Now, I'm going to get the names of the dishes all messed up...but the plata a la plancha with carnitas was so YUMMY!! I especially enjoyed the roasted veggies that were charred and sizzling from the bottom of the cast iron. Now, I don't really understand the habanero sauce that was on top of the dish, but the meat was cooked perfectly, so who cares. I didn't touch the accompaniments because I'm on a keto diet...so the meat and veggies were a PERFECT dinner for me. I didn't miss the tortillas, rice and beans at all.  My BF had the habanero shrimp and added steak option. SOOO good.   Jose was a server.  Incredibly attentive without being overbearing.  He described all the food in great detail to help us understand all of the fancy Mexican herbs that we had never heard of before.    Definitely will be back...maybe for happy hour on a non-work nite.

VSnPq2POyHspOCvJwI0-Dg.text: Everything about Bandito is amazing. Food, music, location, staff, cocktails.  We came twice during our work trip and absolutely love it. Great experience both times.

SqEBQ-cxgcl2EoXLEgCK7g.text: Absolutely fantastic! Wonderful service, really nice atmosphere and wonderful takes on Mexican cuisine. Also, welcome prices after getting fleece on the strip. Had the enchiladas with carnitas, and al pastor.  Great flavor and the street corn side dish was amazing! My wife simply loved the rice, great flavors. Their salsa's were fantastic as well. Short drive/or Uber off the strip and worth it.

pCdupOe6cjgC-EO6iBUTDg.text: Went there with  about 8 friends,  The food was delicious, fantastic atmosphere. The waiters and service on point.  They even had   A entertainer doing card tricks. And drinks are so good. Will definitely be coming back.

OY7YtBtGkKxrpRCT416wEg.text: Amazing chips and salsa, carne asada nachos, and enchiladas.  First visit 2018 - amazing food and service. Server recommended the most amazing enchilada plate. It had one of each type of enchilada with three different sauces. Left raving about it to all my friends.  Second visit 2019 - amazing chips and salsa, delicious food, service lacking. Asked about the three different enchiladas. Server stated enchilada had to all be the same type. No effort made to ask the kitchen staff. Didn't make an effort to recommend a good dish. Seemed annoyed. Threw plates on table instead of nicely placing them down. Busy chatting w bartender. Received kinder service from buss staff.  Food still delicious, however did not feel welcoming.

fh51oh2063qalEyOI8t7MQ.text: Me Gusta!  I work in Hughes Center and have been pretty stoked to dine at this super posh off strip Latin inspired restaurant!  FOOD: The Queso Bandito $8 arrived piping hot and amazingly delicious! Highly recommended starter.  Habanero Shrimp $22 When I read Habanero from the menu I was honestly expecting to exhale fire like a dragon but with some reassurance from our very informative server Natalie the Habanero was actually more savory and not spicy at all. (I was totally pleased) The shrimps are big and plentiful, the veggies were perfect and the tamale was flavorful. Moment of silence for the upscale presentation!!   Great wine selection (Cabernet) $11.00 La Pinata $11.00 perfectly crafted cocktail!!   Serrano Brownie $8.00 was lick the plate clean worthy!  FREE GUAC W/ YELP C/I: Most of it slid right off the "plate" and overall wasn't worth the painful wait!   The Fried Fish Tacos $21 Unsatisfactory dish! For such a bold restaurant I was expecting more flavor and regrettably, it was bland. I was uber excited to try the Mexican street corn and it was a total let-down!! Dry, equally bland and gross! The yelp pictures are deceiving or I wasn't lucky enough last night to get a good batch!  SERVICE: The service started sooo slow & literally took 25 minutes for guacamole. I had to remind my server and so did the nearby table before a gentleman finally delivered it. Another gentleman attempted to clear my queso off the table without even asking! Can you believe that? I gave him the evil eye instead of a piece of my mind. As a result he put it back down quickly!! There was plenty left (uncertain how he missed that). Natalie definitely recovered in the service area on behalf of her co-workers; which made my outdoor dining experience decent. Great restaurant concept but some employees lack confidence like it's their first day. Walking in circles and continually asking what we ordered became annoying after a long work day!   $88+ tip  Unsure if I'll return anytime soon and that feeling sucks because they are nearby my office.

The Shrimp Ceviche looked fresh and tasted fresher!  The Fried Octopus was sooooo tender. Above all was our server, Jose, he was the best part of the experience. vZdKCfU4rvbjd1OWTs7j-A.text: Bandito's name says Latin kitchen.  It is not a typical Mexican restaurant.  It seems they break the mold with what they do--and they do it well.  I was brought water and iced tea as I was looking over the menu.  I also showed my server, Jared, my Yelp check in offer of a free small guacamole.  He went off to the kitchen and returned with the guacamole shortly.  It is a bit different than the standard guacamole but it's really good.    I ordered a cup of  chicken tortilla soup and the brick pressed chicken.  Here's where they break the mold again.  The chicken tortilla soup is a tomato based soup with thin strips of chicken breast and topped with tortilla strips.  It is very good.  The skin of the brick pressed chicken is crispy and the dish comes with a variety of vegetables--cauliflower, carrots,  and potatoes and there's a base of chicken thyme jus on which the chicken and vegetables rest.  It's a very light dish and the vegetables are crispy and not cooked to mush.  For dessert, I got the brownie which has a touch of serrano chili.  The round brownie sits atop a round of dulce de leche ice cream and it's topped with whipped cream with a tinge of lime.  This too is very good.  The restaurant is a really pleasant place.  There is patio dining facing Flamingo and now that temperatures are getting cooler, it would be a good place to sit out.  Service was excellent.  My iced tea was always filled, Jared was excellent in explaining questions I had, and it was a very pleasant dinner before the show I had.

Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brick pressed roasted chicken.

2GSVlzAGWjxLo6-2mHGwmw.text: Bandito Latin Kitchen is about a mile off the main strip and has plenty of parking.  We went for an early dinner, so there were not a lot of other customers.  The ambience was very nice and comfortable.  Almost anywhere you sit there are good panoramic views of the area around the restaurant.  This is due to the openness of seating and windows all around, which also allows a great deal of natural light.  We were seated almost immediately (reservations are great) and our server was very attentive.  She made the experience enjoyable and was very willing to guide us through the menu.  Now to the most important part, the food.  We had the carnitas and the carne asada tacos, they were both very good.  The sides were beans, rice and something akin to pico de gallo but with cherry tomatoes.  The beans and rice were passable but not great and the pico was interesting.  We also had drinks (Mojitos) and those were also good.  Overall, we would recommend this restaurant for an enjoyable dinner away from all the crowds of the Vegas strip.

ObXPtVFx4-iWKBwh_E4neg.text: I had been wanting to try this place since they opened. I'm a huge fan of Mexican food so I was eager to see what this place was about.  Went in around 430 or so. It was pretty empty besides a couple of tables. We asked to sit in the bar area to take advantage of the happy hour. Hostess wasn't sure if we could have happy hour at the regular tables or just in he bar so we sat in the bar area to be safe.  Our waitress came to us rather quickly. Explained that the happy hour had some drink specials and that the appetizers were half off. We decided to go with a couple house margaritas and the queso fundido.  Margaritas were good. Couldn't really taste the tequila but what do you expect for happy hour. Have it a solid 3/5 for the margarita.  I was excited about the queso. A lot of people spoke highly of it. I guess the big deal is that it comes out still bubbling hot. Other than that it was just ok. After it cooled it was very soupy. Small portion as well. If it wasn't for the happy hour I wouldn't recommend it. I know I know... I'm not cheap but come on, yo can go to places like Lindo Michoacan and get the same for about the same price but a bigger portion... and yes I'm sure you're paying for the quality. But still. Had to give it a 3/5.  Got the cup of tortilla soup. Very disappointed. Flavor was good but there was literally a chunk of what seemed to be previously frozen chicken breast in it. No real ingredients per say. Some tortilla strips on the top and a little cheese but in all honesty the tortilla soup from BJs is a little better. 3/5 also.  Had the elote also. Huge fan of Mexican corn. This was probably my favorite thing here. Corn if off the cob and has that sour mayo taste to it that we all know and love. 5/5 for this for sure.  My friend had a combo that came with the tamale. This wasn't the best I've had and not the worst. Tasted dry and a bit too much mass versus the filling. 2/5 for this one.  I did enjoy the michilada. Pretty tasty and they had the chicharron as garnish. They need to have more options with the chicharron as a the star. Just a salad comes with it. Gave that a 5/5.  Overall it's a fantastic looking spot. Not too far from the strip and it's extremely trendy and clean. But for good Mexican good there's plenty more options.

N4ReJN6T_bqNI61F0kFQsg.text: Very cool restaurant a little ways off the strip. Very long walking distance. Good food and received good service from Paul F.

rnM2UeNX6uXTkGcbEVXihw.text: MAN I WANTED TO LOVE THIS PLACE but I just didn't. I've driven past it many times and it looked cool from the outside. When we decided to go for dinner there weren't many people inside which is never a good sign.   Our server was a pro - I'll give him that much. The ambiance is cool, but the food was just "try too hard." Pretentious and snobby. I can make better guacamole in my own kitchen. It was bland and creamy.   I ordered something that our server said is "our take on fajitas." How about we just skip "your take" and just serve fajitas like they're supposed to be. Cauliflower just isn't meant to be served in fajitas. Small portions leave you walking away hungry.   The nervous manager that was walking around had a constant look of concern on his face. It's like they know they are trying so hard to be trendy and scared they're missing it. There's a vibe of insecurity within the staff.   I can go to a humble mom and pop place (Restaurant El Rey) a mile away and enjoy way better Mexican food for a fraction of the price.   I'm sure some people will think it's avant-garde but I'm going to pass on this one. I'll let the tourists and conference go-ers from Wisconsin enjoy this place.

aX_ufGBV73C2bacw8jm6Gg.text: When it comes to naming a Mexican restaurant, you can't get much more predictable than "Bandito", but its location about a mile from the strip meant plenty of free parking, and the "all-day happy hour" on Black Friday meant half price margaritas. It also meant that we took a taxi.  The aforementioned margaritas were quite good, as were the entrees. Both my wife and I had enchiladas, which are served as cheese tortillos with the "filling" on top. My wife had the carnitas with the "Red Bandito" sauce, while I had the al pastor with the "Habanero Pepper Blood Orange" sauce. Neither sauce was particularly spicy, but both were flavorful.  For Mexican food options outside of the Vegas strip, Bandito won't disappoint.

xaxsevCeS600HpR_pECVdQ.text: This location is stunning. The decor is trendy and service was excellent. Amanda was an excellent server. All of the dishes came out beautifully. Sadly, the kitchen sent all of the appetizers out with the meal, except for the soup, which came out later.  Appetizers:  The chips and salsa were fresh and offered amazing flavors. The queso bandito was excellent. It arrived bubbling and was the highlight of the meal. The tortilla soup lacked the typical chicken broth base, leaving you with a chipotle and corn flavor. The octopus was under spiced and over cooked. It was hard and we didn't eat it. The server noticed and removed it from our bill. Drinks: The barbacoa michelada had a nice savory and spicy flavor. The Bandito Margarita was excellent as I love the Cadillac style. The El Guapo was beautiful in presentation, but was super tiny for a $15 drink.  The meal: ( we both ordered the recommended specials) I ordered the habenero shrimp and carne asada was beautiful. The grilled vegetables and tamale were excellent. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and nicely spiced. There was a lot of shells still on them which made them difficult to eat. The carne asada was beautiful but tough. I tried slicing it against the grain into tiny pieces but it was super chewy.  My husband ordered the barbacoa nachos. There was not much cheese or beans which was the most flavorful part of the dish. There was heaps of their version of barbacoa piled high. The barbacoa was more like a Cuban style versus the Mexican traditional flavors. He ended up using the queso dip to dip his chips and left the rest.  We will give them another try for happy hour, sticking to the queso and shrimp. The drinks and service are worth another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus appetizer
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbacoa nachos
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Habenero shrimp and carne asada

TAQhOCJBlkYGwc_-I7tHrw.text: Lucky charm strikes again.  Lauren C. made the suggestion of Bandito for dinner.  She has great suggestions!  It was later in the evening on a weekday so it was easy to get seated immediately.  Our waiter, Carlos, was absolutely a gem all night.  He made us feel like VIP's with his service and charm.  His attentiveness was definitely noticed and appreciated.    As per usual Mexican fare, complimentary chips and salsa were brought to the table.   Carlos asked us if we liked spicy salsa and offered to bring out their habanero salsa.   Holy spicy!  But it had a good flavor spicy which we all enjoyed.  My husband and I decided to split the Chicken Quesadilla as well as the Carnitas Enchiladas. The quesadilla was filled to capacity with chicken, charred heirloom tomatoes, caramelized onions and cheese.  The sweet caramelized onions lifted the flavors to greatness.  The dollop of guac and crema sauce gave a nice compliment to the appetizer.    The enchiladas were no slouch.  The tender carnitas rested gently on top of the enchilada that is filled with cheese and your choice of sauce.  It is accompanied with the traditional pico de gallo, guac and crema sauce.  For our enchilada sauce option, we went with the habanero pepper sauce.  This wasn't nearly quite as hot as their habanero salsa but it still had a great kick and flavor.  The normal rice and beans came with it but the dish also comes with an additional choice.  Let's try the Off the Cob Mexican Street Corn!  Yes it was a great choice and would order again and again.  The kitchen was accommodating since my husband has a cilantro aversion.  All of our dishes were cilantro free and he deeply appreciated their awareness.  I'm excited for this unique kitchen and cantina.  Im already looking forward to my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadilla
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas enchiladas with Mexican street corn

zHoynbeDlzUiWzIv-5VHpg.text: Thank you to our server, Natalie, for the exceptional service and experience on valentine's day for my husband and I.   The food was unique and I liked the way the food was presented. The ingredients were of good quality as well.   I recommend the their Sandia margarita. I forgot what beers I had tried but I really enjoyed everything.   As for food I recommend the tamale sampler for appetizer.  The steak enchiladas were not very good..they were too chewy with not enough salsa..I think they just forgot the ghost pepper(or was it habanero?) salsa we requested because we love spice and we didn't get a hint of it. BUT THE STEAK WAS EXCELLENT!

skrShIU_9GbuMVjQ1rEkJA.text: LOVING a quick Happy Hour date with my husband here! Chips and salsa-Amazing! Fried Octopus-FANTASTIC! Guacamole-Super fresh with big avocado chunks! Rioja-CHECK! Margarita-Double check (for both the Happy Hour marg and La Pinata El! Service-Beth is attentive, friendly, and offers great advice!   We'll totally be back when we're in the area. Thanks, guys!

pc_NU76yvaFhpQuyBElPJA.text: Bandito is a cool little hip Latin flare spot right off the strip. Tuesday nights are taco Tuesdays and so they have a special on their tacos that they serve. This place can get really packed really quickly because the space isn't that big and seating is very close together and reserved. They have great Margaritas especially the Frozen kind, my brother said he he enjoyed his Margarita on the Rocks. They also have some really great non-alcoholic drinks that I suggest you try along with their tableside guacamole. During my visit I ordered the carne asada Taco plate with a side of beans and rice and they're street corn not on the cob I have to say this was the best I've tried while living in Vegas so far.  My carne asada tacos weren't dry in the meat still contain a lot of moisture and flavor. I would absolutely say you should try this place especially on Tuesday nights or Saturday nights if you're in town.

zbH9R7YLyaaDmv9HbmuwoA.text: Great food & service !!!! Thank you Jose for your wonderful hospitality and recommendations !!!!

emwXUfBiETo-jpxcxaI2pA.text: Both the food and service is phenomenal!!!! Very tasty menu that can easily accommodate vegetarians. I ordered the enchiladas with habanero sauce, in place of meat they made them with roasted vegetables. The vegetables included rainbow carrots, purple and white cauliflower - not the typical boring bell peppers and onions.   Great drinks as well! Fresh chips with two types of salsa and you can special order extra spicy salsa made with habanero peppers which has the perfect kick and won't leave your month on fire.   Our server Susan was crazy amazing. Very knowledgeable about the spices, flavors and ingredients that go into the dishes. I've never experienced someone so welcoming at a restaurant.

4JxEFZtoX1drtPxPNmMNlA.text: Went here for a date night, wasn't actually planning on this place but, saw it while we were driving and stopped in. The food was incredible, drinks were unique and the staff was even better. I would recommend this place to anyone! Best Margarita I've ever had, hands down.

N3M8mYK1yH0pD3qmZwHyCQ.text: Clean, great food , love the style of the restaurant,  the service was great , me and my friend went here for lunch and loved it, also the margarita was on point

lA6C8K6K36QnagSHXz1ePA.text: Exceeded my expectations by FAR!!!  I will definitely be back.   Carne Asada taco Octopus taco and  Baja Fish taco.   Fresh made and delicious salsa too

N_bwkB074R3PQ4BLTVhfhw.text: Man this place is great.  My family and I were in LV for a weekend and wanted some flavor.  Yelp recommended this place and it didn't disappoint.  Great service, fantastic food.  Hands down a great find.

GWFsyZGJl2Rtr2-zn-Jhow.text: Heard about this new place and had to try it out when a friend came to visit us from overseas. So, we came here for dinner last night. Our waiter, Tony, was awesome! He made great recommendations on food and even concocted an amazing adult beverage for a friend of mine. The food is delicious with such a blast of flavor! The restaurant has a good vibe. Great place for large groups or even a romantic dinner out. They accommodated me when I asked if they could modify my order a bit. I didn't expect the outstanding customer service. They exceeded my expectations! We will definitely be back!

c2k5sc5cOSDpnWRm7BDA-Q.text: Had dinner last night, food and drink was great and all the staff were so nice and helpful. They seemed to all enjoy working together. Great atmosphere, beautifully decorated, would definitely recommend for a casual yet nice dinner for any couple, friends or a group!

R0WraBY4iFiahkPwefKE7g.text: What a great place.  Great decor and food is to die for. We've driven by many times and this time we stopped.  Ask for Jose he was just outstanding and truly listened to our specialized  order, not spicy.   We had tamales and fajita's.  They were all good.  Guacamole was buttery and tasty.  Try them you'll like them.

sDEXHZwiAUUIBzb69CSoZg.text: Really nice ambience and cool decorations. The service was pretty slow, but a great place for some chips and salsa. They're margaritas were excellent too, I recommend the pineapple one!

LdbS9KQUIbXrRJkhm0CQ7w.text: Came in for "date night" with my husband as we were wanting a place with a great bar and good food. We found it!   We were here for happy hour which starts at 4:30 and runs until 6:30. Had their $5 margaritas and 1/2 off starters. The drinks were wonderful not your typical "watered down happy hour drinks" these are well made and good quality.   The food was fantastic - the guacamole is fresh and creamy, ceviche was perfect and fresh, nachos (with added carne asada) was tasty and huge and just for fun we finished with chicken flautas that were perfectly flaky and full of chicken.   The staff is top notch. We were greeted immediately by the chef who welcomed us from the kitchen as soon as we walked in, the hostess came right over smiled and was cheerful and easy going as we got to decide where we wanted to sit. Our servicer, Colleen was friendly, knowledgeable and super personable; she took super care of us and made our date night super relaxed.   The atmosphere is modern, open, funky and new. We cannot wait until it cools down a bit so we can enjoy the patio and the city lights.   We are locals and will definitely be back and will tell all our friends about our new place    Keep up the great work and standards Bandito's, your crushing it.

3LJY1dWUrfWSHIKv5oDtPw.text: So excited to have this new gem in town. Food and drinks are excelente! Cool ambiance and most of all, center of the strip! This will be our new local spot!

jKcqQauaa1IMDpQSwMJeGQ.text: Service was impeccable. Wait staff was very patient with my questions and our two year old son. Everyone was very friendly. Honestly, I'd give five starts on the service alone. There are a lot of gluten free options but a lot of them involved corn (fine for most but not for me). I got the burrito bowl; I'd definitely get it again. Margaritas were a bit too sweet for me but I'll admit I'm a margarita snob and like to taste my alcohol; the rest of our party enjoyed the margaritas.

tqkoeDJlMWA8wiivgJKpKw.text: The tortilla soup is delish. My cousin had the half chicken and said it was good. My husband had haberno shrimp and my son said his octopus tacos where super. Their lemonade was very tasty. We will differently be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EjdhZuGBCQSFVjTwhFIS2Q.text: Don't let the hipster murals and lighting fixtures fool you, this place is not good. Ordered shrimp tacos that were very over seasoned with salt. I don't believe the cooks are trained to taste the food before they put dishes out. I thought it was just my dish and then I tried my friends chicken fajitas and the meat was so dry luckily there salsa was decent enough to dip the chicken in so it was bearable to eat. You would find a better meal at a Robertos. Go here if you only want margaritas and chips n salsa. Don't waste you money on anything else.

7Cbj43FmQ1EhE_NqlW-d6w.text: We walked from our hotel to this lovely restaurant and not being use to desert heat we were dying, when we walked in the host immediately got us water as we looked like death warmed over.  We then were promptly sat.  They brought out more water and then chips and salsa,  the salsa is fantastic and you get both a tomatillo and another tomato based and they are great!  I was talking with the waitress and I mentioned I like spicier salsas and she brought me another one that was fantastic.  We also got the guacamole and it was one of the best I have ever had.   We then ordered and I got enchiladas with the fabulous Mole sauce and my sweat heart got the tacos, we both did the barbacoa (SP?) and it was very tasty.  It was a little fatty but that just added to the flavor.   You will not be disappointed at all.  PS. Get the Mexican style corn it is great!

PSGfJclrrWpjGf9UYB9T0w.text: This was my first time here and I would love to come back the next time I am in the area. The design and decor are cool and create a fun dining environment. Our waiter, Carlos was very friendly and great at answering questions and making suggestions. I would recommend either the fish tacos or the al pastor enchiladas. I also enjoyed the tasty watermelon margarita. Only comment for improvement would be the rice, a little too crunchy for my liking. Tuesdays are half off on tacos, a good deal to keep in mind if you're planning your dining for the week.
