Ky3utpJ8QuVO-WjQ4rAnHw.text: Fajita meal had small portions, but the meat was good. Three street tacos... the meat was gross. Def not something I will order again. The place itself is nice. LoVE the decor but the meat on the three street tacos is graded not good. Probably won't come here again.

r0dz_6_-QpbMAcG-3oX6gg.text: The atmosphere is gorgeous, the view is spectacular! The food was delicious and the margaritas looked and smelled amazing!! Definitely a fun place to start your nigh out in Las Vegas.

chJVB0QRX85pYCr5-viE2A.text: Great Mexican restauraunt off the strip. We needed a break from the Casino restauraunts and found this place on yelp. We took an uber from the MGM Grand about a 12 minute ride. My wife had the Al Pastor enchiladas and I mixed the 3 taco dinner plate everything was fresh and delicious. Restaurant was clean and service was excellent.

E2oCXJbwIOBi80V-j45QdQ.text: Adding this to my Vegas Favorites Flautas are great starter.  Really good red salsa and tomatillo salsa.  Waitress told us that pretty much everything is made from scratch in this kitchen. Including the margaritas (no premix for sure) Probably the best guacamole I've ever had. Meals were all good.  We went with a group of 10 and everyone enjoyed their meals as well And hubby told me to tell you the Bandito Margaritas are awesome.  Oh, and they brought little churros for us for desserts.  We are with too much eagerness for me to remember to take any photos, so please use your imagination.   Imagine delicious appetizers, meals and drinks, followed by yummy little churros.  And while you are at it, imagine we are all beautiful people at the table.

iXKsdHPUzgAEEKBanlQOhA.text: Wow. What a great find. We were looking for something off-strip and casual and we're so glad we found Bandito. The tomatillo salsa was on point, and the barbacoa tacos were incredible. 10/10 would go again for the awesome food and super friendly staff.

We will definitely be back and be recommending this place to all our friends. They have a watermelon salad right now that is sooooo awesome.

MXNYhdVkVL_bIi9-xDUsTw.text: Great new Latin restaurant! It's only been open six months and is worth the visit. It's located just off of the Strip and has a nice industrial vibe. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The food is great! The Queso Dip was amazing as was the Grilled Halibut Tacos with Al Pastor Potatoes. The menu allows you to pick your side and protein, so you have wiggle room to have the meal you want. Also, try the Jalapeno Margarita! It's really good! Thanks to Tashalee for taking care of us!

fy1hirCcD1E63NzBTxbULg.text: Picked this place for lunch. The location is pretty central on Howard Hughes parkway.  The atmosphere was amazing, somewhat chic modern.  We ordered the octopus to start and it was amazing, very tender and flavorful. The chicken fajitas were amazing with the dipping sauce. Finally, the fillet torta was amazing. This might be one of my new favorite spots. The service was spot on. Will be bringing the office in for happy hour!

XV8AGNy9tGyelTlIoU0CmQ.text: The restaurant was in a intimate art setting it felt like which was really cool- they have a huge mural painted of a horse and cowboy that set the mood!  I ordered the taco plate with Al Pastor and Carne asada with a cheese and jalapeno tamale. The carne asada was savory with a distinct sweet flavor from the pickled onions, the al pastor was similar in taste a savory with a hint of sweet from the pineapple . The beans and rice are similarly run of the mill nothing really stands out, the tamale I was very excited about but was disappointed unfortunately because the masa was very dry and there was little to no cheese or jalapeno, the red suace overwhelmed the flavor of the tamale itself.  My friend ordered the same plate but ordered the "of the cob Mexican street corn" aka an elote. This was obviously very good! So in my opinion skip the tamale go for the corn!  For desert we ordered the tres leches cake and omg we saw  stars! it is very good it's not overly sweet just perfect! It is denser than the run of the mill market tees leches and you can see the hints of vanilla bean in the batter within the cake! They topped this with house-made whipped cream which was subtle sweet touch  and strawberries just perfect.

qMrSSHSnyHSd-Kc3p_499g.text: Enrique was fantastic to us as first timers!! Guiding us through the wine list and food menu knowledgeably. Beautiful looking feel to the place!! The house made guacamole chef sent to the table, so flavorful!! Love the decor!!

vVGA5ncj69hUPYrfqkDsDw.text: Location:  -easy to find (located in Howard Hughes Ctr) btwn Lawrys and STARBUCKS, off the strip -Plenty of FREE PARKING in front -good atmosphere: comfortable seating and great place to have dinner conversation (unlike many hectic places on the strip); there are tvs for the sports fans  We ordered: -pork belly argula salad: FAV dish, unique and flavorful,  PLENTY of pork belly!! I only wished it was a little crunchier. -surf and turf (carnivals, shrimp and cheese tamales): shrimp was best part of this dish -albondigas (meatballs only...we were surprised that this wasn't soup... that was our mistake): it was ok. We wouldn't order again. -sopas (roasted vegs, carnitas, barbarcoa): we enjoyed the roasted vegs the best and that they were bite sized and two of each(which was perfect for our party of 2) -I don't drink anymore, but I noticed some unusual drinks like avocado margaritas... sounded interesting  Customer service: -this was 5 stars -super friendly  I would definitely return. I really enjoyed the atmosphere esp. for a place in Vegas. It's not cheap, but relaxing. I think they have a HH but don't know the details.

jt5onaWtq1i9_IEz6YWPww.text: So, here we are at Bandito's again.  Can I say that we really enjoy this place?  We found it by accident while driving down Flamingo - and I am so glad that we did.  It's an affordable upscale cantina that has the most delicious food served by attentive staff who truly go the extra mile to make the dining experience memorable.  We have been back a handful of times, and have plans to make this one of our preferred restaurants.  Highly recommended!

b03pl7GVIEOjzNYFDi_Fjg.text: Literally gourmet Mexican food. I'm vegan and they gave me such a great meal while the other guests in the party had shrimp, carne asada, and other items and loved it. Service is friendly  and knowledgeable and the guacamole is first rate. The decor and atmosphere are so cool.

QTZE-n1FXT3oHY3oIYYlFA.text: New Mexican restaurant close to the strip love the setting and ambiance at the bar,  food was very good ceviche,tacos and Gin and tonics and decent prices.

CJUpkok_t0ADs1S-MWB10Q.text: The food was FANTASTIC!  Great selection of happy hour appetizers.  And the service was excellent.  Friendly,  attentive,  knowledgeable,  but not intrusive.  Can't wait to come back!

Xqu3iSn3TQC7oEvyei15kA.text: Sadly you have to leave at least one star. My friends and I were very excited to try This place out after hearing all the buzz. The ambience is nice and very modern. The staff look as if they're bored and wander around aimlessly which made my group a bit uncomfortable. The food was very lackluster, very bland and honestly not good. When we finally decided to leave one of the servers decided to take her tip from my friends cash and returned her change with no receipt for verification. When the manager was contacted he proceeded to tell my friend that there's nothing he can do. Overall my friends and I understand this is a new restaurant but if you expect for repeat customers or for people to recommend to others they will need to improve in a lot of areas. 0/5 would recommend or return.

Mgm-yOeF9xephDGvhad_1w.text: Anthony was our waiter and was out standing The food was delicious and water Mellon margarita was yummy Will definitely go back.

476l9buWC3zTk9jc2k0Ebg.text: Sometimes in life you are lucky enough to encounter an experience tailor crafted for you...it doesn't happen often...but when it does it's something to be remembered...this exact thing happened here last night...when we arrived at the bar the entire bar staff walked us through happy hour (4:30-6:30 pm) and took the time to explain the hand crafted cocktails and garnishes to us...the bar itself is something to be seen...the beautifully decorated shelves and copper accessories will keep your eyes entertained while you wait for your cocktail to be made to perfection...at $5 the happy hour margarita and house nachos are a complete steal!!!!!!! Deliciously fabulous...whilst waiting for friends I enjoyed these in the bar area and moved to  the dining room when my friends arrived...after being kindly escorted to our table, we began a food ordering frenzy! Guacamole, queso, ceviche, habanero shrimp with a jalapeno tamale, flautas...you name it, we ordered it. I think we barely spoke while we ate...everything was DIVINE. My friends also ordered mojitos and micheladas which they raved about...the manager Julian was sure to stop by and chat with us during our meal...what a fine gentleman...we felt so welcomed and looked after...which often times in Vegas, is a lost art in the hospitality industry...we can't say enough good things about this new neighborhood gem! We will most certainly be back often. Thank you Bandito for a wonderful evening out!

x0T9ZV9rLpcj2jK5OwIJCg.text: Great Resturant! Nice atmosphere really tasty food and great service. Highly recommended.

2nNYabOZcNy-XM41yMFtEg.text: This was a place that was easy and convenient to the Marriott. Walking distance. The hostess who was also the bartender did a great job in balancing  the  bar and the earl of us. The food was good. Had 2 tacos al pastor and some tortilla soup. Very filling.

Ukr-_Xqh8kWTMIHk7fCNpA.text: Stopped in here for a quick meal + was really impressed with the service. In addition to the chips + salsas, we ordered the side of guacamole, a jalapeno cheese tamale, + the quesadilla (which we made vegetarian). Everything was fresh + filling. The space is open + bright. Service was very fast + friendly, would definitely return.

YVy9TnMEESeupUJubW5dxw.text: I've updated my review solely based on customer service.  The owner did reach out direct and wanted to rectify the issues mentioned so it does show that they care.

z0im8ek8qWi89OGvoK1LPA.text: Amazing vibe and decor.  Loved the food and service.  Try the quesadilla me tacos.  So fresh and filling.

wt6Nq3cTuH7R8aRQtWHKdQ.text: Cool place, good environment, friendly staff, mostly reasonable prices for a vegas tourist-focus place. Fast service times too!   The food left a lot to be desired, though. I ordered the carnitas burrito. Carnitas directly translates into "little meats", but my burrito was stuffed with pork more akin to stew chunks. In addition, the meat was sorely bland. It was certainly no carnitas.   My burrito was topped with "blood orange habanero sauce". It looked a bit more like baby food - pureed butternut squash. The texture and taste was pretty close to pureed butternut squash as well...with a hint of citrus and a tiny bit of heat. I mean, it was tasty - really. It was good, but I envisioned a sweet Citrus sauce with the warming burn that habanero lovingly gives...not ultra-mild squash.   $15 for two street tacos is also a bit of a reach, but that's vegas I guess.   3/5 because the food is just *okay*.

I4qYswB8xX5Dy_VVIlYeYQ.text: Tried this place with my mom and she usually is very picky about fancy places that sell Mexican or any sort of Latin food but she really enjoyed this place and so did I. Ambiance was very colorful, bright and fun! Great cocktail menu selection and food including vegetarian options and flexible on taking ingredients out to meet dietary restrictions. We enjoyed Sangria with our order of numerous appetizers with happy hour that included taquitos and mini sopas and shared a keto friendly dish made with squash all had lots of color and flavor. All very good will be back to try more entrees.

TGypXvUsoprTZxISVHNjgQ.text: Meep   So my friend wanted to try this place after she found it on yelp so I went with it  The decor is super cute our waitress was super nice and made sure she checked on us ....  We got our drinks before we got our water that we originally asked for   But blahhhhh the food was not even worth the price they lack in flavor ALOT we order the ceviche octopus and my friend ordered a salad   You do a get a free check in guacamole I didn't even try it honestly the chips definitely don't taste fresh like house made   The ceviche does not stand out it had nothing to make it special it looked pretty but it wasn't special not much flavor and boring   The octopus dipping sauce was great as long with the dish   But as in terms for a restaurant it's nothing special at all there are so many way better places then here and I love food and I really don't write bad reviews but skip this place there's way better all over

lTyNQ4wJ5h2buYpuszZQAg.text: Awful.  We had such high hopes since we virtually live right across the street and have given it many chances but we are done.  The food is overwrought, fussy and bland.  It feels like this place is trying to find its identity.  With zero luck.  Their menu is confusing with all the different sauces...and the poor waiters have to spend 10 minutes explaining how the menu works!  Being from San Diego, California, we are used to great Mexican food.  This restaurant doesn't have a chance.  The silver lining?  They make a great margarita, albeit expensive, and their chips and salsa are good.  UPDATE:  We gave this restaurant another shot (since it's right across the street from us) and it was A LOT better than the last time we visited!  I had the chicken flautas which were outstanding and their guacamole is to die for!

v_0TdASzxTOe_HuKjlsl9w.text: The only reason this place got 1 star is because of the actually decent food. The staff is absolutely disgusting, they drink and eat on the bar, behind it, sit down and watch tv while customers are awaiting service and watching them. They are loud, sneezing on the drink garnishes, not once in the hour I sat and ate my meal did any bartender or server or bus boy wash their hands. NOT ONE. Absolutely disgusting. I work in the food industry and never in my life have I seen such an unsanitary, obnoxious, and disrespectful set of crew. They not only ate the garnishes and then reached in the jar with dirty hands but proceeded to top drinks with dirty strawberries, they were giving dirty looks to any guest who disturbed their "football game"; a server even refused to give up his seat for a customer because he was watching the game. Distasteful. Disrespectful. And Disappointed. Never. Again.

LI6DkV5bYThFaYy9yBz6Sw.text: I discovered this place from a Facebook advertisement that had caught my attention. We finally made it in a few months later and didn't leave disappointed; but we would had if we didn't have the promotional offer that we came to use. Upon walking in we were immediately greeted and seated. We were asked what we wanted to drink and were given menus. We went to check in on Yelp and saw that in addition to the offer we had, we could also check in to get free chips and guacamole. I remembered seeing the Guacamole on their Yelp before we came and was excited to try it. Unfortunately, the chips and sals were delivered and the guacamole didn't come until after we were almost done with our chips (about ten to fifteen minutes if I had to guess). The guacamole is also deceivingly small as in the photo it looks like a portion large enough for a table of four, this was barely enough for one person. We had emptied out our chips and the server still had not delivered the food we had ordered; granted it takes a long time to cook from scratch but refills of chips, salsa and water should be provided especially because it was a very slow night with only about 4 tables and three servers on staff as well as a manager. When the food was delivered was when the server finally stopped by and asked if we wanted more chips, of course we refused now that our food was here. The food itself was phenomenal. I ordered the stuffed squash and opted to add chicken for an additional $4. I also got a side of Elote (corn and cheese) this was delicious, but no where near worth the $8 they charged for it. Just like the guacamole, it was an underwhelmingly small portion for the price. My BF ordered the fajitas which although tasty, came out in a very small portion and all on separate plates without a plate to use to eat off of once the fajita is made with the tortilla. The server asked how it was right away then didn't come back until long after the food was delivered.   Had we not had a discount; we would have left disappointed. The price point with the discount made the experience welcomed. It's sad that I wouldn't come back here without it considering the lack luster service and small portions for the prices. Don't get e wrong, we eat at high end restaurants frequently, but this isn't one of them; and their price point is double what it should be in my opinion based on the interior, service, location and a few other factors. We will be back when we have the promo, but I suggest they dim the lighting, pay more attention to customers and lower the menu to have the prices make sense for their items. $4 for a side of corn is realistic; $8 for a side of chicken would make more sense.   I'll be back with a coupon for the stuffed acorn squash with chicken; it's something unique and I enjoyed it for the discounted price. I hope they have better customer service next time.

K8QZHvsP0ULJHjolSuTtUg.text: First of all AMAZING chips and salsa! & queso AND GUACAMOLE! SO far I have had the barbaqoa enchiladas and carne asada tacos and haven't had one complaint! MSXX28jRQ12eqllM_VU3dg.text: Went to lunch here with some co-workers. The restaurant is beautiful inside but the seating and tables are not comfortable at all.   The menu is written in a mashup of Spanglish. I guess it is kinda cute and inventive - but we had to look several items up using a translation app to figure out what they were.   Ordered some $18 open tacos and was disappointed. The portion sizes are a little bigger than what you would get from a typical tapas menu. The taste was fine but definitely overpriced for the area. There is a Chipotle in a the connecting parking lot which offers much better value for your Mexican food dollar.   I asked around the table and the most popular dish was the guacamole and chips. That says a lot about the entrees. The waiter did ask how the food was and got several "it was okay" type responses.   The wait staff was very friendly and attentive and made sure our dishes were cleared away when empty and brought drink refills regularly. 5 stars for the wait staff.

Ofcourse I had to get a side of guacamole also made from scratch and had a ton of flavor ! I ordered 2 asada tacos and 1 chicken taco it came with rice and beans I have nothing negative to say about all of it ! fHO8MPlREdchbsiG-y-96g.text: Definitely not worth the price. Limited menu. Above average food. Great to try to say you did, but I more than likely won't be back. Also lacked flavor, had to mix it with their salsa verse to get something good going.

v7YrhNnT9dtJ5pRb0vJXWg.text: My husband and I are from San Diego where you can find amazing Mexican food but Bandito's knocked it out of the park! pnPNiJp-I_YeQ4zqfiXOqw.text: Excellent food and outstanding customer service. The waiter brought us chips and salsas. I'm from California and don't normally get impressed with salsa but this place was an exception. Carlos V. Was our waiter and had to be the most polite waiter I've ever experienced.

S0WOf1Gkuhhaq4Zh7KdhvA.text: This is a hidden gem east of the Strip. The restaurant is located across the street from The Tuscany Hotel and Casino. Let me start by saying the service is EXCELLENT! Ashley the server was extremely attentive and helpful with the menu. The food was outstanding as well starting with their homemade salsas. They carnitas plancha came out hot and sizzling and it wasn't just for show. The food was delicious. I rarely order dessert but this seemed like a good opportunity to. I had the tres leeches cake. Huge portion and yummy. Coming from LA and knowing good Mexican food, I can honestly say this is one of the most enjoyable meals I had. Homemade, delicious and satisfying. I will definitely make a trip here again!

8qC6TzDt3SHWocA-MBwDJw.text: I swear I thought I had left a previous review, but I guess not.. several months back I came in during the day to kill time while waiting to go to Caesar's employment center down the street. Sat at the bar, only had chips, salsa, and guacamole, and it was so good!! I swore I would bring my husband but kinda forgot because we live on the other side of town. Got a Facebook add for buy one get one free entree, so I was ecstatic!! Finally made it over tonight, Thursday, around 6:45pm. They were packed!! Yet, they still sat us without a wait, and let me tell you our waiter was wonderful!! They don't have a huge menu but they have vegetarian options, so color me happy! I got the vegetarian tacos, hubs got the beef enchiladas, and we had chips and salsa. We both loved our food, definitely high quality ingredients, and fresh. The ambiance is awesome, so pretty inside, super clean (including the restroom), and the music is at a perfect volume to where you don't have to yell to have a conversation. As (my) luck would have it, I forgot my phone at home, so I tried to log into my Facebook via hubs phone so I could redeem the coupon, but couldn't remember my password, so I had to have the recovery password sent to my gmail.. gmail wouldn't let me log on thru his phone because it was a "foreign device" and the only way to be able to log on so I could change my Facebook password to log on was if it sent a text to my phone for a code (which was at home).. Long story short I was soooo friggin irritated and we just gave up trying and were just gonna pay the normal bill. Our server ended up honoring it for us anyway. I wish I could have remembered his name but he's a younger guy with sort of a long beard.. the service he provided for us was that of a very high end, fine dining establishment. Moral of the story, we will definitely be back and highly recommend this place to anyone! Side note: if you're worried about anyone hacking into your email account, get a gmail account. Their security features are ridiculously strict lol.

j_j9zRZXEBnxJD7h93O_VA.text: ***Review for 6/6/17  My experience here was simply 'okay.' My co-worker and I tried this place for lunch a few days after their soft launch, so we knew going it not to expect 100% on point service. Honestly, the slow service wasn't even that big of an issue. Ultimately I was just not really impressed by the food.   The style was more of 'chef inspired dishes' that failed to wow. The portions were small and the price tag rather large. I had the enchiladas and they were teeny tiny. The sauce options seemed promising, but I wasn't wowed by any of them either. My dish also came with a side of roasted veggies. This happened to be a few slices of bell peppers and two small baby corns. On the bright side, they included chips and salsa at no cost and the chips were quite delicious. They do have a full bar, but we did not partake for this visit.   The space itself is also a little bit on the small side, meaning it's a bit more intimate and not really a great place for a group. We were also informed their 'happy hour' is only for drinks or apps ordered at the bar and two designated high tops. I can't image it being easy to have happy hour here when it's busy on a Thursday or Friday evening.   Merely an average place, but still decent enough Mexican cuisine if you're craving it!

kOXmGlWVLhH07Q6uv5o2_A.text: We've been enjoying banditos for several months. It's fantastic!  Everything is made from scratch including their handcrafted drinks. Table service includes fresh made chips & 2 types of fresh made salsas. The decor is dramatic & contemporary. Try the fresh guacamole, their queso dip, tamale trio or sope sampler for a start. EQciLKCbh2_Lkhw0ShPXHA.text: I've been to Las Vegas 5 times and this is among the handful of places I've gone to twice (and the ONLY one I've gone to twice in 24 hours). We got the chicken tinga enchiladas, from the plancho with white fish, and carne asada tacos--all unreal!! Even the chips and salsa were better than any other Latin restaurant I've been to.   Get the street corn as your side, you won't regret it.   Can't wait to go back to Vegas to eat here again! In the meantime I'm researching how to make my own copycat recipes from this place! Yum!

THBA5BFWcVxDUuLno4djBg.text: Went there last night to meet friends.  We sat at the bar while we waited.  The bartenders were extremely friendly.  We had a couple Margaritas, best ones I've had in Vegas by far.  Once we were seated and got our food, it was all amazing.  Everything we had was absolutely delicious.  Also, we couldn't ask for better service.  Enrique, our waiter, was very helpful, professional and friendly.  We couldn't have asked for a better night out with friends.   Highly recommend you give this place a try and like all of us who went there last night, this will be a regular place for all of us.  Oh, by the way, the prices for meals there are very inexpensive, so go treat yourself to a fantastic meal and great service.

EKUEtf8vTD8sS20-5lH_aQ.text: Let me just start by saying, in regards to food, we only had chips, guac, and salsa (which were amazing!). A friend and I wound up here merely because we needed to kill time, and it was close to where we were headed. I cannot say enough good things about this place. Yes, it's small, but I absolutely love the decor and vibe of the place. It was an early Tuesday afternoon (of this week) and we sat at the bar. Unfortunately, I saw no name tag, but our receipt said 'Nicole' was who served us; an African American young lady who was an absolute pleasure. Can't wait to bring my fiance here. The chips were warm and fresh, guac was fresh and served with heirloom tomatoes on top, and both salsas (red and green) were amazing. I cannot WAIT to come back and try more than chips and salsa. As a fellow bartender, I was thoroughly impressed by the drink selection, and the fact they actually have 'mixologists' creating and constructing the drinks. Everything is made fresh. Do yourself a favor and check this place out!

KWV5k2GoCDwzQTJf3TJcRg.text: The food and drinks were great, but they lost my reservation that I made over 2 weeks ahead of time for a corporate dinner. Luckily, we were still able to be seated, but it didn't make me look good to my bosses.

uziwkmk63JjxgFTFK0Vkcw.text: I wanted to love this place! It looks really cool inside.. the mural is beautiful & it has a hip vibe! Unfortunately the service is extremely lacking!! SwZif0G5XYCm2it-IoxnFA.text: This place epitomizes the very worst of the food industry. It benefits from a good location and nice decor, but things rapidly go downhill from there. A quick glance at the menu items and you immediately know that this is not authentic Mexican but rather a sad attempt at being original and cutting edge but falling miserably short. The drinks were watered down and punchless, the mojito tasted like rancid dishwasher. I mean, come on: "sparkling wine" in a mojito? How about fresh mint muddled with premium limes and topped with good quality syrup and soda instead? Barbacoa broth and soggy, deep fried pork rinds (sadly called chicharrones) in a michelada? Who comes up with this stuff? So we tried draft beer. Can't go wrong with that right? Wrong! Negra Modelo was flat and smelled of dish soap. The keg was either way old, the lines dirty, or the CO2 pressure needed some tinkering. Food wasn't much better. Fish tacos were dry and tasteless. Al Pastor was way over salted and greasy. Tortillas were rubbery and cold. Tortilla chips were thick and tasted greasy, almost waxy - probably due to being fried in the lowest quality, lowest cost fats. Frijoles charros were so salty I felt my blood pressure rising with every bite. Overall, the food simply did not taste fresh and vibrant. It had that cut-rate, cooked in the cheapest vegetable oil by poorly trained, uninspired staff kind of feel and texture. I wish I could say something positive but this kind of slop should not be allowed in the food scene in Vegas. Charging people good money for this is borderline criminal. We have way too many outstanding food options in this town to tolerate this kind of stuff.

xQ7hsjo-5gOtGlzeFbaypA.text: If you are looking for a new favorite restaurant look no further. The food, drinks, and friendly, genuine service made our experience so special. I don't have anything but positive things to say about this place. Also shoutout to Jared and Jordan. You two made our experience delightful.

Z1gq7UYjKgMs_kV0Af8vgg.text: Great atmosphere and service.  Tashelee, Marcus and Beth behind the bar are awesome!! Food is fresh and wonderful!!!

BLXCp23juNe_eETDnGGOBA.text: This review is based solely on the food. Service was 5 stars, but we probably got such great service because we were the ONLY people in the restaurant. I ordered the special Cuban Torta, meat was a bit on the skimpy side and flavor was very lacking. No salt or pepper on tables so we had to ask for it. Portion to price ratio is way off, ordered rice with my Torta and after 3-4 spoon fulls rice was done. To sum up this place I'd say it's best for drinks and appetizers.

3rAYbEo1koK2JFAaHINcFg.text: This is one of the best places in town.  It is comfortable,  views are as nice as it gets and the food is simply delicious.   I am a local. Any time you go into a place for the first time, there is a hesitancy simply because you don't know what attitude you will receive.  From the moment we walked in we were made to feel like friends. We have since been back 5 times with groups of friends.  Treatment was still the same.  Today I looked around and noticed there is hardly a piece of wood to be found.  It its all steel and glass, I mean huge panels of glass.  No matter where you sit you have a view of the outside, including the Strip.  The view has to be beautiful at night.  We are the city of lights, you know.   Every member of the staff is wonderful.  Diane and Nicole at the bar are the best. Julian is such a good manager I doubt anything or anyone could rattle his cage.  The food is killer.  I had a shrimp burrito with corn on the side.  OMG, I literally could live on that. Best guacamole and chips in town.     Friends are coming into town next week and wanted to spend a happy hour with us, since Bandito has one of the best happy hours. That's where we will be.   Of course you can confirm all this on Google, Face Book and Instagram.

1HOI0osA4dw5YYoG8g-ulg.text: We came here during lunch yesterday and the service was terrible. We got seated immediately and we're given our menus but we didn't see our server for nearly 30 minutes before getting our drink order. We also had to get another employee to bring us chips n salsa a because we were sitting there for at minimum 20 minutes before bringing that to us. The food was good no complaints there but we also asked the server to bring the Habanero sauce which he forgot and we didn't see him till the meal was almost over.  I really hate to give this place two stars as the food was ok but without service I don't feel right giving them any more stars. With such poor service, it's definitely not works going back and paying +$25 for food and drinks.  Could be a regular as I work in the Business complex but won't be back

0PaNMOclSlZpb_xRgDrpMA.text: Back again for an update- 8 months later.  The consistency in staff and detail is refreshing.  The food is still sublime and the Margaritas deserve your attention.  I highly encourage you to bring your friends to Banditos for a feast they won't soon forget.  However, after a few more of these freshly muddled cucumber mojitos I just might- yummmm!  Please disregard all low-star reviews- now I know the truth.  Banditos is not just a pretty building on the corner of Flamingo and Howard Hughes- it is the new standard for Mexican cuisine.  I've been all over the country- So Cal, Austin, Miami, New York, Chicago, you name it- nothing is really close to this quality and attention to detail.  The staff, the food, the music, the ambiance- all are remarkable.  Let me explain...  We opened the door and are immediately greeted in the most gracious of ways- I feel underdressed already.  We are then seated immediately and given a specials menu that is explained in detail. Shortly thereafter, we are introduced to our server- a lovely and knowledgeable lady who is ready with the best recommendations.  The drinks come and they are amazing.  I am not a big drinker, so I choose the "special" Agua Fresca and my lady chooses an incredible vodka drink that arrives in a copper pineapple.  Stunning presentation and the fresh fruit hint at what we can expect when the food comes.  Complimentary chips are delivered with two salsas- both amazing.  But, I choose the fresh guacamole dip.  The freshly made chips and the guac are an irresistible combination.  Before the end of the meal I had every drop of the guac.  The meals recommended were delectable.  I had the Sea Bass and she had the carne asada and habanero shrimp plate.  Fresh grilled vegetables adorn both meals and provide a colorful experience.  It all comes together in an explosion of flavor that has you wondering when the last time was that you ever ate any meal this good.  It's been a great great while for this guy- and that was a meat and potatoes plate.  We were constantly checked on by the most well-trained and courteous staff I can remember.  The owner checked in as well.  Our entire experience took less than an hour.  You will not be disappointed with this restaurant.  Put Banditos on your shortlist of restaurants you must visit.

U43WTc5EfedM5dVY9848bQ.text: I've been here a few times now.  My boyfriend comes more often.  I love the overall feel of the space.  The warm chips with two salsas that's served to start are awesome!  As for the menu and food. My food has been ok.  Nothing to rave about.  My boyfriend however loves and and the people he has sent to try it also love it... I am slightly a food snob though so maybe I'll continue to try new things until I find the item that makes me return.

3siZzIClP2nv1T8H78yvHA.text: Stopped in for some Sunday Happy Hour. First of all, the atmosphere is awesome. Interior design is stimulating and unique. Tony took excellent care of us. Very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive, but knew when to give us some space to relax. Also made a damn fine margarita!  Food was fresh and flavorful. Flautas are a must. Ordered an array of apps for happy hour. All of which were delicious. Chef even stopped by to check up on everything which was a great touch. mex9OH51nheJxdaAv5KpQg.text: IWow! Such a great experience! First off the restaurant is gorgeous. Open, airy, lots of windows, and tall ceilings. Beautiful artwork throughout . Our server was both host and server, and he was on it! He described dishes thoroughly and gave excellent recommendations. Our drinks were always filled and food came out hot. Excellent service! We started off with the octopus, super tender, great flavor, and just lightly fried. Must try! The margaritas were top notch. Strong, and very tasty. We had the house, and watermelon margaritas. The watermelon was by far my favorite. Not to sweet, but with a bang. For $5 you really cant go wrong.  Also the chango wango was delish. It was a tiki drink that was an outstanding pina colada! The tamale trio was superb. Seasoned, moist masa, filled to the brim with various fillings. My fave was the chicken tinga tamales with shredded  chicken and a bomb red sauce. Enchilida plate was great, pretty good size portion. I opted for the fried white fish, and chicken tinga. The protein was served on top. The green sauce put this dish over the top, as well as blood orange sauce. The pastor potatoes were amazing. Delicate potatoes cooked in like an Enchilada sauce, another must try. The steak was a large portion, very juicy and not overcooked. The Mexican corn was a great touch to the dish.  Ok now, the dessert-man oh man! Margarita cheesecake! Creamy cheesecake, topped with a bruleed pineapple, fruit salsa, and little crunchy mint pieces! Amazing layers of flavor and sweetness. Great food and excellent service will have me coming back here soon! Ps. I hope they bring back the avocado margarita so I can try!

-3wFX9kdVG91u--Z_N492g.text: This place immediately became my favorite spot for Mexican food! It's located 3 blocks east of the Las Vegas Strip. The food is authentic and delicious. It's a little pricey compared to other Mexican restaurants, but you definitely get what you pay for.    The Watermelon Margarita comes highly recommended.   We started off with Asada Nachos. It was a great shareable portion. We also ordered the green chicken enchiladas, it comes with rice and beans and you get to choose a 3rd side. I picked the jalapeno and cheese tamale. My husband ordered the tacos de asadas, his also came with rice and beans and he chose the Mexican street corn on the side. We were blown away with how phenomenal the food was! It's so hard so find a good Mexican restaurant that has such an authentic taste.   Service was great. Our server was on his "A" game. Checked in on us frequently and made sure we were well taken care of.   We can't wait to come back again!

nd7Pp1N1MXF-dC18pRsq7g.text: Bandito had a few flaws, but the excellent ambiance, food, and happy hour warrants them four stars.   My boyfriend and I came in on a Sunday for happy hour. They seated us at a two person table which was fine, but the restaurant wasn't very busy and the table got pretty full after ordering 3-4 starters, chips, salsa, drinks, and the candle on the table. It took a little while for our server to greet us and she didn't mention happy hour until we did, but after that everything ran smoothly.   The $5 Bandito margaritas are a great price and strong. We got a free guacamole for checking in on Yelp (apparently there's a specific "Yelp guacamole". It looks small but tasted great and lasted surprisingly long. For starters we shared the ceviche, sopes sampler, and chicken tinga flautas. All starters are 1/2 off during appetizers so another steal. The sopes and the flautas were amazing, especially the flautas. They're like mini quesadillas wrapped up like egg rolls and stuffed with cheesy chicken. They serve it with a red enchilada sauce and another sauce I couldn't identify but both were really good.   The only dish I didn't care for much was the ceviche. I bit into what felt like glass, and while examining it the host came over and told me it was probably salt and took it away. The did have some big black pieces of salt on the dish, but the pieces I bit into were clear and had black markings on it so I don't know. I didn't want to eat any more of the ceviche just in case but I didn't care for it much to start with. It seemed overly fragrant, almost floral.   Overall Bandito is a solid solid spot for Happy Hour any day of the week. I will most definitely come back despite the few hiccups we experienced because it makes me feel fancy and the food and drinks were delicious.

lZR13nNBPZK8Ln-YrhF6SA.text: Bandito is one of the most attractive Latin restaurants in Vegas with a great happy hour. They are A-Ok with me...  Bandito Service:  My first visit was for an early 6 PM dinner, party of 7 please.  I was the first to arrive, and they brought me to the table.  I was brought warm chips and salsa immediately, sweet.  Our server was extremely friendly and was so great with getting our last happy hour drinks and appetizer orders in before 6:30 PM.  Around 7:30 PM, a huge dinner rush came in, and we didn't see our server as much after the entrees were served.  He apologized and mentioned the dinner rush. He was trying his best, but it appears they were short staffed for the Friday dinner rush.  Bandito la comida: The $5 happy hour margaritas were tasty and made well. We hit happy hour and sampled the following appetizers.  Fried Octopus: Great red Bandito sauce and the octopus was cooked well.  The tamales in the Tamale Trio came out dry for us.  This took away the potential for their flavor, but the Jalapeno cheese was my favorite.  The Bandito Sope Sampler also came out dry and was very salty in taste.  I enjoyed the Chicken Quesadilla and the Turkey Chorizo Albondigas was hands down the best appetizer.  I'm definitely ordering the Albondigas again.  I had the Barbarcoa Tacos and they also came out salty and dry.  If I were to guess, the plates were probably left out under a heating lamp or on the counter too long before being served to us resulting in the unusual dryness of the plates.  Bandito Ambiance:  I LOVE the decor of Bandito, absolutely stunning and a lot of fun.  It's an industrial look with Contemporary Latin decor throughout the restaurant.  Numerous light bulbs hang that create this great look and the dios de los muertos mural is gorgeous.  Your social media fans will love your posts here. =)  I think I might have caught the Bandito crew on an off night and they still did A-OK in my book.  They started off strong and kind of faded in the end.  The 1/2 price Happy Hour and beautiful decor will definitely get me back to try more dishes, but that's another Yelp tale.  Enjoy!

LlEFBD60ezuY7yNS9BX4nQ.text: No surprise that they're now closed. A plethora of Mexican restaurants in Vegas with better food & quality. The food at Bandito didn't equal the value of items on the menu. Thus, the end result.

2CO0dBNuvDCzBwQizYV3eg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for quite a while and after hearing pretty good things from my parents, decided to give it a try.  The menu is surprisingly small I thought but everything on it looked great! My girl and I sat down and were blown away by how creative and beautiful the restaurant is.  I love it honestly and couldn't stop looking around.    Chips and two salsas (red and green) were promptly served as well as a small plate of free guacamole (from checking in on Yelp).  We then ordered a bandito margarita, the sope sampler for appetizer and then the habanero shrimp with carne asada and the chicken tinga flautas (an appetizer but eaten as an entree) for entrees respectively.    Chips and salsas:  Good and the salsas had a different sweetness that I haven't had before.  Seemed out of place but I kept on chowing down. Guacamole:  Not the best I've had but fresh, well presented, and great for it being free. Sope sampler:  Came with two servings of each sope (barbacoa, carnitas, and vegetarian).  Barbacoa was delicious, carnitas was dry but had a good flavor, and the vegetarian was weird and did not belong. Habanero shrimp with carne asada:  The shrimp were very large and came with about five of them.  Very tasty, well cooked, and had a great sauce.  Carne asada (medium rare) was not medium rare, under-seasoned, and chewy.  These were on top of roasted vegetables which did not belong at all. Chicken tinga flautas: Only tried one bite and they seemed just alright to me. Bandito margarita:  Amazing!  Finally a place in town that knows how to make a proper margarita.  I love how they don't add sweet and sour.  That's a sin in the margarita world.  Still though, to add some sweetness, they added some agave nectar.  Pros:  Gorgeous interior, prompt and kind service, and great drinks. Cons:  Food was just average and was a it pricey.  I like that they include vegetarian options and vegetables in general but they didn't work at all.  I've never seen broccoli and cauliflower at any Mexican restaurant and I applaud Bandito for trying something new but it just did not work out.    I feel like if I come back it will be during happy hour, solely for the drinks and maybe try a few of their other offerings since the price will be better.

kOX1rYvVezAWlDxF0LlQMg.text: Presentation: Standard Flavors: Delicious Service: Very quick, Sunday evening Portions: Great size for the price Price: Reasonable $$  Walked into a beautifully lit dining area on a Sunday evening. Other than a half a dozen patrons, the crowd was not an issue. Service was very helpful, we were greeted and served by Heather. She gave us the specials for that evening and we took her recommendation for the street corn, which we dont regret. I ordered the shrimp enchiladas which were delicious and the shrimp were plentiful and not overcooked. We had the free chips and guacamole for checking in which was awesome. Guacamole was very good and creamy. The salsas were also very good one green which was a bit more tangy and the red was very mild. Chips were fresh and 3xtra crispy and hard to stay away from. Everything was well seasoned and delicious. My wife ordered the fish tacos served both grilled or battered and fried. My wife had the fried version. Nice flaky fish portions which extended beyond the tortillas. She paired it with extra lime and her go to, sour cream. Overall great dining experience. Caramel churros....oh my. Come try them.

5xbaVGEIXk_5AIleIVWRqQ.text: Save yourself both the trouble and (more importantly) the money and don't come here. Subpar service, tasteless cold food, and an expensive menu to round up our experience really made this place, at best, mediocre. There's a myriad of Latin and Mexican food offerings scattered all over the strip and this is by far one of the less memorable places.   We started with a $12 plate of guacamole which was should be considered as a side. Bland. And you could tell that they've had problems justifying the price and size because they reinforced the item with "free" chips and dip. Secondly, we ordered the chicken fajitas as well as the chicken tinga flautas. The latter of the two were honestly the only memorable part of the meal. When we promptly asked for our check, our server yelled across the restaurant at the bartender for our bill. It was a semi-busy Saturday night but that was completely rude. Altogether, a $50 experience that made me only want to complain about it on Yelp the whole entire time.

MSIPiIuzKgmtLZvSAj8d_w.text: This is a dining experience!  The customer service is impeccable. Our server 'Jose' was outstanding. Definitely ask to be seated in his section. I have also lived in Mexico and I know what True authentic Mexican cuisine tastes like.  The food was outstanding! My favorite dishes were the 'chicken tinga flautas and grilled octopus'. SFzMEO83XB57l-X_HYGsNw.text: Enjoyed the soft opening night event and got to sample a few drinks and dishes. The chips and salsa are amazing. The green salsa was our favorite and will be a new craving for me. They offered us their "hot habanero salsa" in addition but we thought that is was the mildest of the three. Delicious, but mild. Maybe they're still working out the recipe.   We started with the ceviche appetizer! Very fresh and had a perfect dice to the ingredients to pair with their chips. We did add a little lime juice to it to up the tartness.  Hubby got the Carne Asada tacos and loved the fresh tortillas. He got roasted veg on the side and said they were slightly too crispy/fresh still and he would have preferred a little more "roast" to them but he ate them all anyway.   I had the Al Paster enchiladas with the Salsa Verde sauce and boy were those good. Lots of flavor in the sauces and I was swiping my rice and everything through my plate to get every drop.   We got two drinks: Change Wango and the El Guapo Margarita with Grand Marnier Caviar. Both were perfectly balanced. Yum! We will be back!  Thank you for having us!

C2PixzqAcQitZrpXgpG9_w.text: I've been meaning to try this place for quite some time, and I'm really glad I finally did. They definitely exceeded my expectations. Not only is the exterior beautifully designed, the interior is truly a sight to see as well. If you're a fan of margaritas, this is the place to be. They have a spectacular Taco Tuesday special that's great for unwinding after a long work day. I can't stop thinking about their Al Pastor tacos- they're that good. I suggest getting the fried Baja Fish; the grilled version is good too. I was also very pleased by their appetizers. The Queso Bandito was phenomenal. Tashalee was our incredible server the night I went, and she took great care of my friend and I. I recommend coming with an empty stomach, you won't regret it!

JGagN49vFTQlrjZ1Sjm_9Q.text: We keep passing it by and finally made it in. We were very satisfied. Tony was a great server. The food and drink were tasted great and priced even better. The atmosphere was great. We will definitely be going back.

0N3DEUwRVyPPruMoH1pM2w.text: Bandito was such a pleasant surprise for us.   The decor looks amazing and it was caused us to stop in.   We like to find spots that aren't on LV blvd and Bandito did the job!!!   The service we received from the server was stellar and I wish I could remember his name.   No pressure and good assistance with making selections.    TIP make sure to check in to get a free order of chips and guacamole.    I got a 3 taco order and it was amazing!! Good portion sizes with sides of rice and beans, it was filling for the price and i crushed it.   My wife got the carne asada salad and if you look at the pictures you can see how amazing the portion sizes are.  With a good sitting location my wife and I really enjoyed our experience ( no kids woo) and Bandito will definitely be a place to go when we makes our semi annual treks to the LV.     This is a  solid 4 stars plus a star for the amazing server ( I'm going to check my receipt for his name he was that good) and plus a star for the decor and experience.     This place is clearly getting attacked with fake reviews(accounts with no friends/reviews yet they write the Old Testament for a negative review), real Yelpers can see right through it.   If you come here expecting an 'authentic' Mexican food experience then that is on you , they never claimed to offer that   Just do your thing Bandito!!!!!!!

8bd5npzg5SvMdGRqej_cGg.text: I really don't like leaving reviews like this for restaurants because I feel that everyone's experience is different.. however I just need to let people know how disappointing the food was at this place. Everything had absolutely no flavor, they charge you $13 for the smallest plate of guacamole I've ever seen in my life, and again NO FLAVOR! A little bit of salt could really go a long way.   We were given two different menus, and when we asked what the difference was the server had no idea and just said that we can order from either one, so when we were ready to order (which took our server about 30 minutes to come and finally take our order because he was too busy joking around with his coworkers behind the bar) he tells us we can't order from one menu because it's the lunch menu.... so we ended up ordering from the "right" menu and when we get our food it was just complete and utter disappointment. I believe I saw someone else leave a review and say that if you like authentic Mexican food do not come to this place and I just have to 100% back them up.   The only thing I can say was good about this place was my michilada.. but I've still had better.  It makes sense now why I've been getting Facebook messages almost once a week from this place pretty much begging me to come eat here and waste my money... it's really a shame cuz I wanted to like this place but everything from the food to the service was just awful.

QA_xwmD5dordIaR3ZX4gfA.text: Overpriced "Latin" influenced food (as advertised)  This is not an authentic Mexican restaurant.  I would recommend Casa Don Juan for that experience.    Decor is the only thing I liked.   I wonder who the owner is because they're obviously not Latino. Lol  Typical Off the strip restaurant where they think they're in Beverly Hills with those prices.   I would skip it if you like authenticity.

Ifq9i067JH77JByfYmD8Ew.text: The aesthetic of this place is beautiful, clean, and definitely interesting - It's not like most Mexican restaurants. The food however, I thought was exactly like most Mexican restaurants.   Surely it was what I ordered, but it seemed just like any other taco shop. I went with Carnitas tacos ($18) which comes with three tacos, rice, and beans. Very good, but I'd rather spend half as much for something that tastes just as good and is a block from my house.  That being said, I owe it to Bandito for a second visit, thanks to the host on the way out. I forgot her name, but she sold me on the more unique side of the menu; like the octopus and the habanero shrimp. She even told me my tacos, I could have gotten a combination instead of all three being carnitas!  TL/DR: skip the tacos for something more unusual and come during HH

I had the guacamole which was delicious and enjoyed the salsa with the chips. Great start. I ordered the vegetable tacos which were quite tasty and good for late dinner, but the rice on the side seemed to be under or over cooked. It was as hard as a rock! The beans were tasty and made just right for my preference. It was all good besides the rice, but it was not the best Mexican dish I have had. I also had a $1 margarita for National Margarita day which was fine for $1, but I would not pay $9 for a regular glass of it (Bandito Margarita).   Would I go back? Yes. LZWpz84Dj7mbvUmvOscSRg.text: So came to Bandito celebrate roommate graduation from UNLV. I was excited because the pictures seen both the food and the interior design looks amazing! The interior definitely lived up to the hype. The art mural as soon as walk in beautiful piece of artwork. I like the open space set up from the open kitchen, bar area is small but fan the way it set up in the middle of the restaurant, and there separate area for private party or large groups. Everything is very upscale and modern.  The food in my opinion never lived up to the pictures or hype. The Sandia Margarita was straight up legit! The most memorable taste of the night. Food went with the Grilled Chicken Tinga tacos. The presentation was solid and looked like legit street tacos. The flavors fell short. The chicken never had distinct flavor, the heirloom tomato is nice compliment, and tortilla fresh. All together nothing exciting or wow factor for me. The refried beans and rice. Plain Jane nothing exciting. Since more upscale the portion size are small.   The service was absolutely five stars. It was pretty big party think over 10 of us. She did amazing job! On top of everything the whole night!

CUwh2DTy0P2AgtCInHQO_Q.text: Warning... this review is long... but read it...I don't do reviews often...unless I like a place that much I dont bother... my family owns a restaurant here in Vegas and overseas and I rarely like places enough to do reviews. Not saying that because I'm a food snob, but I know what it takes to put out quality food...Reviews can really sway your audience...but I had to say I will be back! Definitely worth the money. Very nice, clean, atmosphere and great service.   Starters: Chips and salsa are just great! Came with green and red salsa and warm, fresh chips with the perfect amount of salt. Check-in to get the free chips and guacamole too. The Guacamole is delicious! I should have ordered more before we left! We took the salsa and chips to go because they are that tasty... I couldn't bare to not finish them!  Cocktails: the Sandia was great! It's a watermelon margarita and it was perfect! Its sweet but not over bearing... fresh and delicious! I love the glassware too! Had a salt rim which paired perfectly with the sweetness. Try it!  ***I would come just for the chips, salsa, guacamole, and drinks if the food was so so but it is not so so at all.  Main Course: I had the beef enchiladas! Substituted black beans for the charro beans which were full of flavor (I am sure they are delicious too but I wanted to try them because I always get pinto beans). It came with fluffy mexican rice. Not everyone can cook rice... this was done the right way! The beef enchiladas were perfect... I would not change a thing and cannot find anything wrong at all... the meat was tender and seasoned perfectly... I am glad I had left overs because after this review... I'm making some eggs and eating it with it... just made a new meal Banditos... add it to the menu!!!   My boyfriend had the shrimp tacos. He also got black beans and Mexican rice. I tried a bite of the taco and man... it was bomb! He opted for the habanero sauce on the side... it is too hot for us but had great flavor and consistency... but the shrimp taco was so good, it didnt need the sauce... shrimp was buttery and juicy but seasoned well...all the toppings were fresh and balanced well with the shrimp.   Dessert: Not happening... we were too full to eat it... but now I definitely have to go back and try it if they have it.  They had a buy one get one entree on one of the social media sites...not sure which one... my boyfriend had it... he told me about this place and I'm so glad he did! It's definitely up there for me. Help this place survive! This place is great! It's a little off the strip...in Howard Hughes Center... I made a joke and said somebody's grandma is back there...just being silly... but for real... somebody's grandma is back there putting their heart and soul into every dish! Great job!

K_YNbqVUKrgw1icxvn62Wg.text: I really, really wanted to like this place...we came here last Saturday night for dinner pretty late for dinner around 9pm and the place was dead. This was good news for us because we were all starving! Immediately got seated and this was looking up but what happened was people who are working here standing round and not ensuring everyone was getting helped. The only people hustling here were our waiter which I think he had the whole restaurant and the bus boy. After an extended wait to order drinks and promised the best margarita we then began the other just trying to get drinks. This is Vegas Baby the last thing you want is for customers to be waiting for adult beverages. Our waiter came back and even apologized and said it was embarrassing we had to wait so long. he was right and appreciated him not making blame...well not the best margarita I have ever had but darn near. So now with a drink in hand and some appetizers on the table things were looking up.(Point needs to be made if you make an offer on Yelp for free chips and guacamole don't discourage customers from ordering it because its smaller than the normal portion).   Not so much now instead of just taking our order it was off to help others. After flagging him down now to place our order he goes over the specials which would've really nice to know based on the 30 mins + we were sitting here. Another annoying part here if your kids 15-18 and their friends don't talk them out of nachos if that's what they want regardless if they just had some chips and salsa. On to the ordering I had the 1/2 chicken and my wife and our friends had the shrimp special with carne asada. After now another 30 mins+ our waiter comes over while delivering other food and lets us know the computer malfunctioned and our order never transmitted...Hmm? Whatever at this point its now past 10p and everyone is just getting filled up on chips where they earned 1 star for me these were so tasty and the salsa was delicious both the red and green. Also forgot to add we ordered the fresh chicharrones and they were so fresh they were still popping in the basket and they were delicious another 1/2 star. What earned them the other 2.5 stars was the food. Everything after we finally ate was awesome. My chicken so perfectly cooked and very juicy. My wife's dish with the shrimp and steak was also amazing. My daughter said probably the best nachos she has ever had and her friend who is such a picky eater said the same. So well done on the food Bandito Kitchen! The decor and vibe of this place is also great and like i said really wanted to love this place but without the right service would not keep me rushing back. For a casual dinning experience off strip should not take nearly 2 hours to have dinner. You work on that and I will see about coming back because you guys have nailed all the other stuff.

z3TH9OSz6Lz9UOZSgKO6qA.text: I decided to come here with 3 other friends a few days ago. I've been wanting to try this place since it had good reviews.  It was 6.30pm on Monday night and not so busy. The menu is easy to read and surprisingly small.  I checked in Yelp to get Chips and salsas. I waited for it for a while. Finally, I waved at the waiter to get his attention. He said he forgot. Then he came back with the chips that includes red and green salsa. They were ok.  Friends ordered a bandito margarita, I think it was discounted. The waiter says Half Chicken $24 is his very favorite, so I went with it.  Food was just average and was a bit pricey.  I do love the decor!  I think if I come back it will be during happy hour.

7T-a3oXK2-MSOH4ncwUSIA.text: Loved this place. It's not your authentic Mexican Restaurant but the concept is really good. It's different but super tasty fusion. I had the Octopus Tacos that were so good and my husband had the Shrimp Enchiladas that were delicious also. Hope to go back soon and try more dishes

qucOGOvh_b9MZIlH1Cs2SA.text: I visited Bandito for a mixer that took up the entire bar area with business professionals trying to mingle and sell their services or products.  They had a live musician playing music, amazing drink specialties, and tasty food for everyone.  I absolutely loved their watermelon margarita!  The servers and bartenders were speedily and friendly.  I couldn't have asked for anything more.

6olkVHr40QiSfSeuzIfJjw.text: This was another restaurant that has been bookmarked for quite some time. Finally had a chance to check it out last Saturday.  My friend and I arrived about 4:30pm and were seated immediately. There were only a few other diners there when we arrived but the pace picked up around 5.  I checked here on Yelp and got the free guac which came with chips and two different kinds of salsa. The chips were warm, thin, and fresh. Loved both of the salsas and the guacamole was delicious too.  My friend and I both ordered the chicken enchiladas but I got mine with the potatoes al pastor and the corn for an up-charge and She stuck with the beans and rice. The enchiladas are slightly different as the chicken was outside, not in them. But no matter, the chicken was cooked perfectly, was juicy and had a great flavor. I really loved the corn too, I'd definitely get that again. The potatoes were good, but didn't find anything too special about them, especially for a 3$ charge. My friend said her rice and beans were good.  Neither of us drank so can't comment on that. We were full so no desert either. Service was great. Our waters were refilled often and we were checked on frequently.  We both agreed we would definitively eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchiladas with potatoes and al pastor and corn instead of rice and beans (up charge for this)
Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check in on yelp and this is what you get!

dnKNqkOfZXWZQfkTvjwARg.text: Was here last night for the first time for my brother's birthday, a party of 7,  we were immediately sat since it seemed to be a pretty slow night. Got our first round of cocktails and ordered a couple appetizers, sides and entrees. Food came out and everything was great, especially the side of Mexican corn and potatoes al pastor. During this time, our server never came back to check and see if we enjoyed the food or to ask if any of us wanted another round of cocktails but by the time anybody came to the table we were done with our food and it was still never offered.   We all currently work in the service industry, so after watching our server stand at the bar well and talk to his coworkers rather than coming over to be attentive to our table we were frustrated. At least 10 minutes passed after all plates were taken from our table, again our server is nowhere to be found and we weren't offered any dessert. To receive our check we had to get up and ask a bartender to print it for us. She ended up dropping our bill off, which was $300, our finally our server is there to take my card. Again, we work in the service industry and normally give 20% tip to any service we receive, but this guy just didn't care.   All in all, this rating is based solely on the service not the food.

xn5hrhs9YerI5Q5E8lYp1g.text: We were in Vegas for the weekend and decided to venture out and try new places. If you check in, you get free guacamole and chips! We ordered two burritos. I got mine fried (chimichanga). It was pretty good. The place itself was beautiful!! Very modern decor! It was spacious and VERY clean. I loved the decor. The service was good. It's not authentic Mexican food and the I felt it was a little overpriced for what we got. I did enjoy my dinner though.

aVZlVr3hlhZZJT-Kuf6_XA.text: This was only my second time here, but I'm definitely a fan! Food and service were both very good and the atmosphere is bright, busy without being too loud, and inviting.  To start, I'm a sucker for a great bread, or in this case, chips and salsa. Bandito's doesn't disappoint. They offer two salsas - one green/tomatillo, the other red. We ordered guac and the tamale trio as our appetizers (the pork tamale was my favorite). I got the braised octopus tacos as my entree, hubby got the carne asada tacos. The octopus was perfectly cooked - tender and flavorful, but not overpowering. Just writing this review (a few days later) makes me want to go back, just for this dish!  Reservations are recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Octopus Tacos

nf__kjL1u4ikNn56rCXI_A.text: I really enjoyed this wonderful dining experience in Las Vegas.  Off the main Strip but still close to all the action.  This Mexican restaurant is fashionable, clean, comfortable, provides excellent friendly service and --- yes the food is great.  I went there with a party of five and everyone ordered something different.  From the appetizers, to the main courses and even recolonizing the birthday of one of our guests, we had a great time.  Parking - right by the entrance door.  Very easy, close and large parking lot.  The guacamole appetizer was very flavorful and was gobbled up pretty fast.  For an entree I had the Barbarcoa which was flavored just right and presented very well.  I highly recommend this location.  You're not rushed, you're treated like a valued customer, actually thanked, and treated to a truly nice environment.

pIVZGToptAceTQWhF5BiNg.text: The food here was fantastic...although a bit pricey...but it is in Vegas...just off the strip. The bartender was also very engaging and hooked us up with very tasty drinks during happy hour paying attention to when we were getting low...LOL.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that our wait staff was not very attentive. He forgot to bring my side of corn and really didn't check on us after our food came out. I had to flag him down for water refills and my corn. We were very satisfied with everything else and have put this on our list of restaraunts to eat at (a pretty extensive one at that) when we come back to Las Vegas....although not on the top of the list

1qiiY2zTAtjJ9ajnLLB-Pg.text: So I really had to sit and think about this review a few days before writing it because I think this place has a lot of potential and with a few tweaks they can become a True go to spot for locals and tourist. I rated it 4 stars but it really would be about a 3.6 so I'll just give the benefit of the doubt and go back once more to see how I feel.  So to start it's located next to Sushi H20 In the Howard Hughes complex closest to flamingo street. It is a very clean restaurant with a nice classy/casual ambiance. It's not overly big but still big enough to host a big party which was what we had . The staff was incredibly nice and accommodating and that really helped me push my rating up. I could see this as a place to get a few drinks before a night out on the strip  Now onto the food- to start they prepare their food a little different which is a interesting concept , when you order a dish like enchiladas instead of the meat being cooked inside they place it on top which is something to get use to, also the presentation of all the food was amazing.I ordered the brick pressed toasted chicken and the best part of it was the mixed vegetables, the chicken was baked with skin and served with the skin and all the other fatty parts which is not my thing so I wouldn't order this again. I got to try the chicken quesadilla which was good the ceviche was so so and my buddy got the fish tacos which looked amazing and he said they tasted like they looked.   Knowing this place has half off happy hour and the tacos are 50% off I will be back only to try the fish tacos. Even though it's located behind the strip you will be paying strip prices so be prepared .

TtLMBDEvHE8Ebn1N6JLILw.text: As a longtime resident of Texas and knowledgeable about Mexican food in California, Arizona, New Mexico and Texas takes a lot to impress me where Mexican food goes, however, THE BEST without question is Bandito Latin Kitchen and Cantina in Las Vegas.  A few blocks off the strip on Flamingo and Hughes Center.  Everything is prepared fresh when you order.  The guacamole was so fresh and creamy.  The flautas has a wrap that I swear was like a beef Wellington crust; light and flaky, melt in your mouth!!! The enchiladas were the same!  Choose from six different sauces (the Habanero Blood Orange was our favorite.  Chips and Salsa were also the best we've ever had!!! We will be back EVERY TIME we visit Vegas!!!!

R3dNEtWHTCMYFGUWksXJAA.text: My two friends and I really enjoyed our meal at Bandito.  The decor is beautiful and inviting.  We came in for a late meal and thought they might close soon.  But the host encouraged us to come in and take our time ordering.  As soon as we sat down, we were served some delicious chips and salsa.  Our waiter "Tony" gave us some great recommendations.  The 3 of us split two entrees:  fish tacos and carne asada enchiladas with a tasty green sauce (sorry, I don't recall the sauce name).  The entrees came with 3 items per order and Tony had the entrees split on 3 plates for us.  What a nice extra touch.  It was a LOT of food, but we ate it all.  My favorite thing on the plate was their version of elote.  I would definitely come back here on my next trip to Vegas.

UI_dl0yaLb5zSWA7bVb-rQ.text: This is an excellent restaurant. The food is fresh and tasty. The seafood ceviche was awesome. Love the tacos al pastor and grilled octopus. Will come back next time I am in Vegas

ELvsWpbfbq7lqAT4iECQ-A.text: Highlight was the tacos and salsa verde. Margaritas also very nice. Enchiladas average. nice to get off the strip and relax in a modern hip environment.

y2V3_45dWAzOe6wF3tV2Yw.text: Checked it out for dinner on a Saturday night. I felt like it was pricier than most reviews let on. Ambience is good, less casual than I expected. Virtually empty, maybe four tables were full at 7pm. The food was just ok...great service. I prob won't come back. Hovering on that 3 stars but I'll go with 4 since I'm not really a Latin/Mexican food fan to begin with. Benefit of the doubt that it's just me.

dlsX1J7nifG6KMaCh_TDIg.text: Fabulous. Had Shrimp Habanero and thought it was outstanding. Delicious roasted veggies and very large serving. Good margarita. Our server brought 2 guacamole one of which was free with yelp. Said he just brought 2 because there were 5 of us - classy!  Loved the decor and will be back again.

NtOF_24fCDpeRvbv6Zbelw.text: Wow! Last minute plan to grab dinner with mom. Had seen IG review...thought we'd give it a try. Sooooo glad we did. Food was amazing - from the ceviche to the tacos. Drinks were even better!!  And the staff - except Carlos and Julian were incredible. Just kidding!!!  Carlos and Julian made our night!!!  Definitely will be back!  Thank you guys for making it such an incredible night.

3CRTW3QB5y35F0jZZw2wWQ.text: Octopus tacos ..... saw it on the menu and had to come, lo and behold they were amazing. Great bartending staff. Highly recommend.

hPhhnb1nWzmx-Ns1NZOiuA.text: Good food and drinks.  They got my order wrong twice, but I eventually ate what they brought the 2nd time since it  looked good and it was delicious.  Everyone in our large party loved their food.  The mixed drinks and margaritas were delicious!  There was no one else there when we showed up on a Sunday afternoon.  There are great vegetarian options, especially the build your own burrito option.  Their roasted veggies are delicious!  I doubt we will go there again because of the location -- we happened to be in the vicinity already and wanted to eat nearby -- but it was great food!

X64G5Jf15R3Q3P_oEou9XQ.text: Everything was great. The chips and salsa, guac, entrees service the whole nine yards

NE0jzucZfSVDW0cgCBEA7g.text: This is trendy hipster at its finest. This isn't somewhere I would go out of my way to take people. Their food is great if you want someone to make your basic TexMex foods from recipes.com. Otherwise there is no soul and inspiration to their food. Just what you can expect from downtown Portland or Seattle. The atmosphere is stereotypical and borderline offensive but I guess that is what is popular these days. The price is for the location not the food. But the chips and salsa are incredible which is why this is two starts. Save your self the tasteless trendy hipster experience and go to any other authentic TexMex place in Vegas. They're a dime a dozen one block up or down from here and are cheaper with better atmosphere.

M3JyRcVWWZ5crAvz20vxKg.text: Was recommended by my LYFT driver as she bartended there as well. Food was just okay. Nothing special for $18-20 entrees. Desserts are bleh. Corn was super good. Guacamole was not good.  Happy hour might be better for cheaper prices.

VOEcS_1V7_d2r6ppR5Q-aA.text: This was a special treat, excellent food, great prices and the staff is wonderful, will certainly go back next time we are in town. The Habanero Shrimp is excellent as well as the Carnitas tacos, with homemade salsa! Restaurant is beautiful and great atmosphere.

Cmpp_DJK3wdaYZIba42YGg.text: New Mexican restaurant in the Howard Hughes Center. Excellent food and terrific service- especially so for being a brand new establishment. Chicken tacos were very good. House made chips (shipped to property al dente and finished in their frier) were terrific. Roasted corn side with tacos was the bomb. Good solid Mexican food at very reasonable prices in a cool environment. Recommend.

J5lQ4nXKbPGWe3n6fIfCdA.text: came into today to check this place out with 3 other friends for lunch. upon entry the place is very new, trendy & has a very beautiful look. the owner happened to be who seated us & he was very welcoming, kind & even checked on how everything was during & at the end of our meal. we got the chips with the red salsa & green salsa, also tried to habanero Salsa which were all amazing! when you check in on Yelp you also get a complimentary chips & guacamole which I thought was a nice touch.  I got the carne asada tacos (sorry didn't take a picture but there's plenty on this yelp page lol) which came with rice, beans & a 3rd side of my choice which was the Mexican street corn which was pretty good as well! I give the carne asada tacos a 3.5/5. our servers name was Diane, she was so awesome, very patient, had a great attitude & also very personable. I would definitely eat here again! they've only been open for 4 months & it's going to be a nice addition to that area. I wish them the best of luck!

K5zhHrIvCoqbtAnTpQzSPQ.text: While I'm an advocate for more localized, authentic mexican cuisines, I will say that the gastronomic levels of their gourmet dishes can give El Dorado Cantina a run for their money.   I'm certainly glad that Howard Hughes picked up a restaurant that isn't a franchise restaurant.   CHECK IN OFFER/CHIPS & SALSA: Get that check in offer! Because we all know that we love a good guac thrown in the mix of salsa. Chips & salsa re-mix!!!! In all honesty, it's the green salsa that really out shined the guac. If you're a fan of extra citrus and lots and lots of cilantro. Go green!  OCTOPUS TACO: It came with rice and beans + a side, and the got the "elote" type corn. It was soft, tender, and packed with flavor. Of course, if you love that gamey, seafood flavor of an octopus, you'll like this. None of the fixings overpowered the octopus, because the octopus runs the show in this taco. I definitely recommend this if you're looking to be a little adventurous--steering away from the usual al pastors and carne asadas.   BANDITO HOUSE MICHELADA: Idk if they make their own chili powder for it, but that tajin is LIT! It is a lot spicier. They put two pieces of fried pork short ribs (chicharron style). Take a bite of that chicharron. Then, take a big sip of the Michelada with the Tajin spice and just wait until you feel your taste buds throw a fiesta in your mouth. You're welcome.   VENUE: It's definitely a good venue take your vendors, clients, or any business lunch/dinner for that matter. It's a great place to have a nice bougie dinner before the turn up with a big party. Date night? You betcha! it's cute, hip, and upscale for sure. The mural is also calls for a good photo opp or a 'gram.   SERVICE: Service was pretty slow during lunch, but we weren't in much of a rush and it wasn't very busy there either. However, the staff was super attentive with five different people checking in on us-- also with quite the sense of humor. So props to them.   Definitely worth a try and worth bookmarking for all you hip, out-of-town, foodies.
