1S3Cs5xixvpR9ewnIp8WrQ.text: Could leave one star if I could. Awful service, food, and manager.   Heard good things. Place looked decent, cute, trendy.   Initially from the get go, even the guacamole was awful. Our server brought it out and immediately and knew it just tasted like over ripe, mashed avocados. When she came over to ask out was she already knew we didn't like it because she asked if we thought it was OK or if I needed more spices. Then when our entrees came out .... that's when the real disappointment began. So the elite/street corn tasted just like cold, soggy corn and sour cream. My tamales were made of some soft gross dough of some sort (not plantains?) and were served cold and flavorless. I told her to take them back immediately. Our nachos were extremely disappointing and were comparison to 7-Eleven nachos that were cold, barely drizzled with cheese and were cheap in every sense of the word.   Our quesadillas were fairly decent considering it's pretty hard to mess up cheese and chicken.   Additionally we asked for our first round of margaritas with a certain type of tequila (Herradura) and it was not clearly the brand we asked for. The next round of that same margarita were served with different drink accessories, for example my friend got a jalapeno on her same drink I ordered. Why?  Then when the The separate checks were delivered all the orders were put onto the wrong checks, and then when my friend received her check and put cash in for change, our waiter brought out her change with 20% taken out as a tip for herself already with no receipt!!! We called to complain but DAMN this was a terrible dinner. Awful.  We called and spoke to the manager about about my friend being shorted not provide a receipt, he did not care and we brought it up to him that he did not care he hung up on us. We work in the service industry and this is absolutely unacceptable. Beware of this place!!!

QGBYEaf-l91svHFyRJhl8Q.text: My family took me here for my birthday, it was a sunday night so i'm guessing/hoping that is why it was so slow. The waiter was nice and helpful  The building is really cool and would maybe go back when it's nice outside to try the patio. Find it very odd that chips and salsa cost $, even at the most expensive restaurants they don't charge for chips. The food was good, but pricey, $21 for 3 tacos and a drop of rice and beans just isn't something I was too impressed with. Over $20 for a quesadilla and it doesn't come with anything, that's extreme! The street corn was actually very good flavor, they have it pre cut on a plate for you, it's rich, share it as a side with someone  Don't think i'll be back, good food, but they need better prices for the amount of food, and maybe some music make it more lively

3zm2vN87IraRS6RIqOjS9w.text: Let's tell  the truth. My food was AMAZING. We were Welcome by Ken the restaurant manager and were 5 People from the industry (3 From the Bellagio) . Ken  (the GM )was very pleasant and we felt very welcome right away. I went for the Vegi Wrap and the side of Potatoes Al Pastor. The vegi wrap has some romanesco in it....and those potatoes....those potatoes........Yumm.... I may go back and sit at the bar and order a side of the fingerlings potatoes Al pastor. The service was excellent and the vibe fabulous. I do not say this because I am in the industry but I had a fabulous time with my friends. I did not see the bill since my friend invite us. Thank you Ken for the great time, you will see me soon .

EMc78MH-G41NcIazcc9LzA.text: The ambience is vibrant, the music was a great Latin vibe to get your appetite in gear. We dined here for lunch during the week and were grateful for the Yelp deal of guacamole with warmed chips. We ordered the Agua Fresca, the chicken flautas and carnitas burrito. LhY7UbkIurIj-zOyfErYmw.text: Well Danny L, we just ate at Bandito and had Jose as our server and he was very kind and did a great job. You know it isn't nice to call people names and hide behind social media. However, judging from your poor grammar I'm guessing you probably are not well educated or just a very sad person. Too bad for you your review was more telling on your character than sweet Jose's. Food was great, service was great. I recommend Bandito and ask for Jose!! Shannon Colle, Missouri

I_iRlFR8gswRdjjlef87lA.text: A new pretty good not your typical American Mexican restaurant...you can taste the quality in the ingredients. Here is what was ordered:  Smoking Bandito - Pretty good flavor from the infusion with the adobada with a smokey, light chili savory taste to the sweet and sour from the lime and tequila.  Guacamole - Real fresh avocados with real good flavor...green salsa was fire with that garlic but the red was so so....  Queso Bandito - who doesn't like queso and chips...fire  Seafood Ceviche - Not the best ceviche i had....tasted and felt more like poke then ceviche  Chicharron & Arugula - One of those salads you can eat everyday and not get tired of it. It was spicy and salty from the pork belly chicharron...one of the highlights of this restaurant  Pulled Chicken Flautas - ehhhh...like my homies say "there are better things on the menu"  Tacos - Tried at least one of each...you can tell the freshness and quality of the ingredients with the Carnitas and Chicken Tinga my favorites....  Brick Pressed Roasted Chicken - the rice that it comes with for some reason was fire...so is the elote corn....chicken is good and is a solid dish.  Carne Asada & Chicken Tinga Enchiladas - Excellent and done well and the rice is fire.  Margartia Cheesecake - similar to a keylime cheesecake...  Overall this is a great addition to the Las Vegas scene and offers an excellent take on Mexican food in a trendy setting

DHvthfrj03gEeqBJ4Au3Lw.text: Great meal and great service. Tony was a great waiter. The salsa and guacamole were really fresh.  Primo recommendations. Would definitely visit again and recommend to friends.

cTN0oAYb_PaURf8ZH_Cmrw.text: Amazing happy hour.. $5 margaritas $5 fresh watermelon margaritas... half price appetizers! We took our sales team there and had amazing food and great service!

qUo8sVpj8FGu4qWN0s2nyw.text: I really wanted to like this place. The decor and ambiance is great. I made a reservation on a Friday night for a high top table for date night with my husband. I think the food is probably good but we didn't get past the appetizer. To start there was no one at the hostess station when we came in so we had to wait several minutes. rUdQmLi2lSCeyLKupvi00A.text: Wow..wow..wow. Enjoying a wonderful meal at Bandito. caP3xcylZDGCcFAAbSO6DA.text: This place is really great. The modern atmosphere and ambiance is perfect. The food is really good and the Margaritas are fantastic! I love finding gems like this in Vegas! Not to far off the strip and well worth it to add it in to your trip if you are in town and looking for something else!

gO75n1Dk80ZGUjLklUREjA.text: I stopped in to try this new spot on Flamingo and Paradise close to the airport. First of all they were extremely friendly greeted me at the door and said they love locals please have a seat and come back before I even taste the food got an assortment of tasty items in the head drink specials I got a cucumber pineapple drink and their Margarita which is outstanding like salt on the rim. My meal was able bodegas turkey and a loaded nacho chips that were very good. I will be back to try this one of mine that the side of town for good Mexican fresh concept High ceilings great artwork very tasty food very good service.

Fs_OQYPjUle-vE3zq6eNOg.text: The first 2 items we ordered were unavailable...not a good way to start. The barbacoa michelada was warm...a michelada should never be warm.  Drinks also came 2 minutes before our food which I didn't like. Definitely would have tried another drink if it came sooner.    The panache or whatever were small. Almost a lunch portion but at $22 definitely not a lunch portion price.  The carne asada was maybe 4 ounces of steak and although cooked perfectly it wasn't worth the price, neither were the 4 shrimp that came with my friends order.  The vegetables were delicious however.  The habanaro salsa and sauce were tasty but not hot at all.    I realize the place is new but it still needs a lot of work. I will at least come back once in the next month to order what I originally wanted and see if the service and timing has improved.  The atmosphere is nice and it had potential but for the same price El Dorado kills this place.

C3KE0AxYwqVhE1bwCRNqbA.text: A few months ago, I was very excited to try this place and I was disappointed. As far as decor, it is a cool and modern place. However the service is not great at all and the food is okay.  I went on a Friday night and it was empty in there except for a few people around the bar area. My boyfriend and I were seated at a huge table even though it was the two of us. Then our server only visited our table a total of 2 times (once to get our drink order and once to bring the check). We had random workers stop by to ask how things were and to bring out our food. They weren't very organized and every interaction was kind of awkward.  Although the service was not great, I believe that it could be fixed if the staff would have interacted with each other a little more and had a game plan for the few customers in the restaurant. They just seemed so unsure of themselves and we could pick up on it. Despite everything though, the chicken quesadillas were good.

3aFNl4L5cNRhjKMRDHN-Aw.text: great food great service by carlos the server. the menu is unbelievable the tinga flautas are so good and the ceviche.if you  are inthe are few minutes off the crazy las vegas blvd go to bandito latin kitchen  you won't regreted

b0Dn7GIiBK0E75LYtLQCWQ.text: Was a nice atmosphere. I had the carne asada tacos which were good I didn't like the beans and rice that came with it. I liked that it was spacious and the decor was pretty. I will come here again to eat.

i7sn-LJj4JO-rKSeeAvZsQ.text: Decided to go check this new place out for lunch a few days ago. My wife works in the Howard Hughes Center which is right next to Bandito's in this place has been much anticipated by people that work in that area.  It lived up to the hype in my opinion for sure!   I went with the burrito. Got shrimp and chicken, beans, rice, salsa, guacamole. The shrimp were huge inside. There probably weren't many of them (maybe 3 jumbo) but it gave it great crunch and nice added flavor in my opinion.   The guacamole was on the side and it was creamy. I generally prefer a little chunky guac but it was still very tasty and had grape tomato halves in it.   On top, I had the salsa rojo which is supposed to have a little kick but did not have much of one in my opinion. I generally like spicy but what it lacked in kick it carried in flavor.   The service was great. I realize that where new places often struggle is with their service. This was not the case at Bandito's. Our server was great, the other staff regularly filled my water. The manager came over to ask us how we were doing and then even removed some finished plates from the table.   The place is very nicely decorated. They have a beautiful mural on the wall! Some nice soft music and great ambience.   The burritos were about $18 a piece which is a little bit on the high side for a lunch outing but it's a nicer place so that's more accepted I guess.   Give it a shot, I'll certainly be back!

-aVawX2wg5X4Oh9D5J-vSA.text: New place - very interesting decor and totally cool vibe.  Bright and exciting interior, comfy booth seats and split booths.  But the food- it was so much better than the "Mexican food" with which I am familiar. It was more flavorful and absolutely delicious-everything was really good!  More 'latin' than 'Mexican'.  Fresher.  Not greasy.  First visit yesterday. It was happy hour and the appetizers were 1/2 off.  Good deal at apps $5 ea.  Within the hour a wonderful Spanish Guitarist entertained- that was great!  Started with the guacamole and chips, chicken quesadilla (a must!!) and queso with slivers of red and yellow peppers- served with small tortillas.  All great.  I was full - but continued on to an entire. I had carne asada enchiladas. Served with just enough rice and (whole) beans and vegetables. Each bite was interesting-great flavor-spice heat level is a self regulated style. Sauces are served on the side. Jose, our waiter, was super. Informative and upbeat-didn't oversell but his suggestions were True to description. I will go back and take friends. Highly recommended!

9Bq2FMK8wogw4oq70ipwRw.text: Great place for lunch meetings. It's not too loud, great modern decor, and the architectural design just lends it's self for conversation. The food is outstanding, and the portion sizes are perfect. The cherry on top was their server Jessica, who greeted us with her wonderful smile and friendly attitude. I would definitely come again.

W5g5KXM6jtAmxW-3K1VQmw.text: Bandito Latin Kitchen has a warm and inviting atmosphere with great service and excellent food (the prices are very reasonable as well).  The staff are super friendly and attentive.  It is the perfect place to have a business lunch, especially since it is so close to the UNLV campus.  I have had the Barbacoa Empanadas and the Carne Asada Tacos which were both super delicious.  Even my very very picky eating friend loved the food here.  I will be recommending Bandito to everyone I know.  It is a hidden gem!

FfQVQgt39Yyu82kLJk3tvQ.text: Simply fantastico!  What a great spot for a romantic dinner or for a large group. I was flying in to celebrate my hubbys birthday with 8 guests and the level of service was spectacular. They really know how to treat their guests!  From speaking with Jessica over  the phone (so seamless and professional), to meeting Jake (amazing manager) and then having Tony (waiter/bartender/go to guy)- I couldn't of asked for a better night!  We did the pre-fix $55 menu (enough food to feed a small army) and the open bar package ($40 for 2 hours) was TOTALLY worth it. We never had an empty drink or wanted for anything. They really know how to treat their customers.  The food was amazing. Guacamole was so fresh and the salsas were divine! Highly recommend the octopus as well as the ceviche. Both very fresh. Most of my group ordered the habanero shrimp and steak. The steak melted like butter in your mouth and the shrimp were large and tender (although VERY SPICY- would suggest possibly ordering sauce on the side if that's not your thing).  Fantastic tequila selection and Enrique makes a wonderful drink as does Tony! They have top shelf liquor and service.  Can't say enough great things about this place. Great prices for GREAT food. It is TOTALLY worth going and I doubt you will be disappointed.

L9bj4Xk9XSKTTszQKBpizg.text: Awesome place! Great server name Jose C. We love love him. He is very accommodating, good costumer service, and excellent job! We will definitely come back because of him! He deserve to be acknowledged! We came because of the wine tasting event and he's been so good as our server! Kudos to you,Jose!

Xf7Ksmv0rjFz4TqT_ifSyw.text: They're are an elegant upscale restauranteith great customer service also if you like Birria you should try their michelada de birria

dQsUwRHw8I6oUrJSZ0BJ8w.text: I feel bad leaving a one star review but we had a very unpleasant time at this restaurant this week. I suggest going elsewhere! Cool decor; however service and food quality were awful.  We are local and live very close to this restaurant so we were very excited to give a new neighborhood restaurant a try. The design of the restaurant is stunning! But that's all I have for a positive note.  We went to the restaurant this week on a weekday and the restaurant was not busy, mostly open tables. We walk in and hostess is just starring at us, no greeting. Then waiter doesn't greet us for quite awhile once seated, when he does, he says he will be back and he has another assistant server helping him. The second server comes no greeting just places water and chips and salsa. The salsa was actually awesome! The waiter took at least another ten minutes to return then takes order, I got a beer, I kid you not it took 30 minutes to get a beer, and I was watching the bartenders doing side jobs and relaxing, um can I pour my own beer at this point? Server just kept coming to the table saying your beer will be right out...the whole time this is happening I am watching the hostess walk back and forth through the restaurant space eating chips....back and forth eating chips in the middle of the restaurant! The manager is just walking in circles doing nothing, when all guests around us looked irritated with the experience.  Ok fine, maybe I can ignore all of these service issues and the food will be fine. Food comes, I ordered the Baja Fish Tacos, he ordered the Al Pastor Tacos. My tacos were so over cooked they tasted more like chicken strips than fish. No flavor on either taco just bland cheap ingredients, not even plated well. When we are paying $21 for a plate of 3 tacos with one bite of beans, rice and corn on the side you expect it to be at least semi flavorful.   Too expensive, poor service, horrible food quality.  I will not be visiting this establishment again and I hate to have to say it but I would suggest you don't either :/.  So many other decent restaurant options close by, not worth it to go here. Sorry.

ZXGsLtdbjSg3CLlL_zI3VA.text: I'm very disappointed with this restaurant. I called to make a reservation and when we arrived, there was no table available.  We were seated by the bar, and changed to a table after we ordered the drinks. Our waitress messed our orders; she forgot to place half of the order, and she brought an appetizer to our table. The food took a long time to arrive. One of our friends had ordered black bean instead of the beans with pork, and her order did not arrive as she had asked.  The waiter stated that she would bring the black beans, but she never did.  At the end, my friend asked to have the black beans to go.  I read all of the review prior to making the reservation, and I had high expectations for this restaurant.  The food was very good and the appetizers were a must; however, customer services must be a priority for this restaurant. The waitress seemed to be annoyed with us and barely came to our table.

cmwmX7zInu6LEjSf8SVbhg.text: If you're a fan of high end Mexican and haven't been here yet in Vegas, WTF are you waiting for?  My go-to favorite in LV for this type of food is Border Grill, but I think Bandito brings a little more to the table!  Their drinks are gorgeous, the flavors are authentic as can be while still maintaining a high end appearance/presentation, and all this for less than strip prices.  I've only been here a couple times for Lunch, but need to check back in for dinner.  with the cool lighting and layout i'm sure it's probably even better at night.  Now after reliving this i need a margarita and some carnitas - oh well, it's not new years resolution time just yet!

9pqBMe0Cu12cECZrGvYrDw.text: I heard a lot about this place and I decided to check it out yesterday for taco Tuesday. I usually go to borracha but I wanted to try somewhere different, upon arrival I found the decor to be awesome ! I loved the octopus tacos I enjoyed everything we tried but this tacos stood out and were my favorite! I appreciate the presentation and elegance that Bandito puts into their food. Service was a little slow and somewhat unfriendly and then around 9pm  they began a after party I guess but the DJ was more annoying than anything. It got too loud and the music being played ruined my experience. The place was pretty empty so I don't get the loud DJ music? The men smoking hookah outside bothering every girl that walked by made for an uncomfortable feeling. I wanted to enjoy food and drinks at a restaurant if I want to hear a DJ and be harassed I'll go to a nightclub! I don't get that whole concept. Overall I give the decor a 5 star , food a 4.5 star and service a 3 star. I thought it was a cool place I would have stayed longer and spent more money but the "after party" made me reconsider. I will go back for the food but I'll do it before 9pm.  Kudos to the Chef I hope they stick to being a restaurant with good food and not so much a party place because this is a place that is enjoyable for business types after work.

Sk39CRkEtEkfU8Idtc0H4Q.text: Great time! Party of six and we enjoyed ourself!!! Staff is very nice and food was delish!!!

7Ox0Dm_mW7o-QkEMAcQtVQ.text: Great ambiance... Came for dinner and drinks  with friends. Mural was cool and had a hip  vibe. Friendly staff. Open kitchen is nice.  The ceviche wasnt that great, felt like it needed more citrus and there wasnt much flavor or juice. Also it doesn't come with chips but we used the chips that came with the salsa for it. But the chicken tinga enchiladas were great. The tacos came with so much protein, thought it was excellent value. Churros were delicious. Micheladas are good. vg0jfifVUZ4xPrv5PUCAWA.text: Super excited to try this new place and it did not disappoint! We started with queso for an appetizer which was an excellent choice! I had the chicken tacos and my friend had enchiladas. Both were excellent. But what was more impressive was the service! Our servers name was Paul and he made wonderful suggestions on the menu. He was very knowledgeable and professional. The level of service was top notch! We will definitely be back and will request Paul as a server.

o7QZZ_5a3Ygu2pxlD7biRg.text: This place is awesome! The service was great and food was amazing. We are definitely coming back soon!  I definitely recommend this to anyone

A1jl8vIe2XRqNg8rQ-o3zQ.text: Two of us dined here this afternoon and had a wonderful experience.  We were greeted as soon as we came in and provided with warm chips and two types of fresh salsa as well as drinks. The decor, artwork, and color scheme of the restaurant is visually pleasing.  We ordered the tacos al pastor and grilled Baja fish tacos.  Both came with achiote rice and beans plus a third side item.  We chose potatoes al pastor and roasted vegetables for the extra sides.  All of the food was freshly prepared and elegantly presented not to mention delicious. This is definitely authentic Latin American food with an emphasis on quality ingredients at an affordable price.  We must give special thanks to our waiter Carlos Villanueva who provided top notch customer service and attended to all of our needs.  Also, thank you to Kabari (not sure if I've spelled her name correctly). She also greeted us, checked in on how we were doing, and when we were getting our to-go box ensured we had more fresh chips and salsa for later.  We highly recommend you go visit Bandito Latin Kitchen - for the excellent cuisine and the kindness and hospitality of the staff!  We will definitely be back soon!

There were two salsas with the chips and of curse the green salsa was very good, red to but I go with the green one. Also very nice place clean, the colors the red and the gray and of curse the portraits and the cutest Luchador by the door next to the host stand. I will decently go back.

g6Y2Uh1PjKSM1PodNSnbzA.text: Everything was excellent. Carlos was our server and was extremely attentive. Fish tacos and Pan fried Halibut were both excellent as was the street corn. This is a place that will be around for a long time.

QnfliWTpScXyg6komEBprQ.text: Delicious food with a fresh take on Latin cuisine. The size portions are more like tapas. I ordered the tacos which come with 2 for about $15. The tacos are the size of like street tacos. You get rice, beans, and an additional side. The side item portions were small as well. Luckily, I wasn't starving, if I was I might take away a star. bsTtGXQ-jHfwXp9vmba5rA.text: Great experience. Jose was our waiter and he made us feel welcomed. He was friendly and funny. Homemade salsas were great along with the fresh guacamole. Fried octopus was delicious along with the rest of the meal. My partner had several varieties of tacos that you can interchange to give you a variety to try. Live music was fun and atmosphere was pleasant. Give this Latin food spot a try...you won't be disappointed.

VI9Un-CNk7mr1X4KhDbE7Q.text: This place is wonderful! The food is awesome and margaritas to die for! Paul was a awesome server.

iZm7VogR3lhdQrLnhS_tDQ.text: Banditos looked really awesome when we drove by the other day so we couldn't wait to check it out! Everything was amazing. We ordered guacamole which was awesome and you don't really need it because they will keep bringing chips and salsa for the table which is awesome on its own.  I had the carnitas enchiladas with Creamed Salsa Verde and they were delicious. They were different than normal enchiladas because the meat was on top but I loved that because I ended up eating more meat and less of the cheese.  My husband had a special which was the Cubano torta which was like a Cuban sandwich and he loved his as well. Our friends loved their food too and there was more than enough for all of us!  The service was great we dealt with the bartender, manager and server and they were all helpful, friendly and welcoming which can be difficult to find in Vegas. We will definitely go back!

TgX9z22Zq0C656SIw4spOQ.text: If you eat here. Ask for Jose. He is the best waiter that I have had the pleasure of serving me in a long time. The food was amazing. I strongly recommend the tamales trio.

WYnYNyoCxymEDGVf3KbwRQ.text: Ambiance: Excellent, the colors and paintings of the restaurant is spectacular. The design isn't too flashy but it's very eye catching. The color coordination blends so smoothly making you look up after every bite   Food: Amazing, Everything is so fresh and tasteful. You can taste fresh in each of the items they have. In my opinion that says a lot about a restaurant.   Staff: Phenomenal, everyone is so friendly and helpful starting from the manager to host to kitchen staff. You guys are awesome.   I recommend this place to anyone that has seen them. You must try it. Don't miss out

XkKvbHehZxwhswolklreJw.text: Had my sons 18th birthday dinner here.  It's very accommodating seating 14 of us, made the reservation in the morning with no problems especially for a Friday night.  Food is good.  Service is really good.  Portions are small.  Cocktails are good too.  Price is reasonable.

J8j9JCGpc1BR_iSuwbuXpw.text: Delicious upper crust latino cuisine. Reggaeton music playing in the distant while the friendly service brings out the hot specialty dishes. Perfect night to try Bandito out for the first time,  National Margarita day!  Safe walking distance to the strip,  next to some hefty competiton for dining options here on Flamingo. Upscale Hispanic ambiance with surrounding glass walls boasts post familial alley with a modern Latino vibe. And in the middle of the floor a bar carrying all your tequila dreams and margarita mixed drinks. The food was so fresh and delicious. Chicken,  pork,  beef, seafood and fresh fish selections. Empandas were made fresh, and sat atop a nice corn salsa. Hot tortilla chips served with 3 different smooth salsas (make sure you ask to try their hot variation ). Several different margaritas to choose from to wash that down with.

They forgot our flantas and never said anything about it. The just removed it from our bill. We literally took a bite of everything and couldn't eat anymore. The waiter noticed and didn't say a word about why we didn't eat anything. We literally left a table full of food. We were looking forward to this place. Sad that it wasn't what the reviews stated.

dubQ4YdYI3xSGXCkFrb_MA.text: This restaurant is hidden gem in Las Vegas. My boyfriend and I were trying to avoid the busy traffic around the The Strip and found this divine Mexican restaurant. The atmosphere is modern with a spectacular insight of Latin American culture. It was nice to step out from the loud crowd of The Strip and enjoy a peaceful dinner.  The food was delicious with True Latin flavors with a twist. We tried the guacamole, the carne asada and chicken tacos. They were soooo tasty along with the street corn on the side. Yummy! The Aguas Frescas are a must to try. They are flavorful and refreshing.  This whole experience couldn't be possible without the spectacular service we received. Our waiter, Jacob, was so knowledgeable and gave amazing recommendations like the dessert.   I can't wait to visit again and try the rest of the menu.

9B3ZMW-gd28QshIJqQUqIw.text: As I'm eating my left overs from last night I felt like this place deserves this following review. We had reservations at 7:30, and was greeted and sat as we walked in. We went on a Monday to take advantage of the drink specials, and omg were they delicious. For starters  we got the guacamole, queso Bandito, fried octopus and the chicken tortilla soup- all were amazing!!! Seriously, so good. As my entree I got the beef enchiladas and they were so good. The service was incredible, I believe his name was Jared- he took such great care of us, and was on it. We literally didn't have to ask for anything. The food came out super quick, but the vibe didn't feel rushed. We spent 3 hours eating and drinking having a great time. I can't wait to come back!

5s97Kafv1NPUkCVIqv1fEQ.text: Went to Bandito for a late lunch and was pleasantly surprised with the food. Great guacamole and salsas. The ceviche was also pretty good. Decor of the restaurant is cool. I would definitely suggest checking this place out. I'll be back.

zu-U8mi75TKTsYMip6aBMQ.text: Came here on our first night visiting Vegas because we wanted some authentic Mexican food slightly off the strip, and this place did not disappoint! We made it in for happy hour and we both found it so awesome they allow you to still participate sitting at a table. In NYC, most places make you sit at the bar in order to participate in happy hour. The waiter was so nice in alerting us about the happy hour options--which are all phenomenal and very generous--as well as coming back to our table towards the end of happy hour to see if we wanted to order anything else before it ended. We found that very kind and we sure did order more! The food itself was incredible and very unique. And holy moly order the guac. The decor was also really nice and was a nice balance between upscale but comfortable. I must also add that whoever the gentleman who was the host the night we were in was so friendly and made us feel so welcome. What a great way to start off our vacation.

39UD2gAg-sPE9z40e-DYQA.text: This place is very nice if you want to try some Latin food out. Our server was very cautious about my diet restrictions and helped me choose from different options. Since I am so used to have delicious tacos in very reasonable price, paying $11 to a fish taco hurt my eyes  overall it was a good experience

anRUmpNxoWOs5S1mTc_gXA.text: We called and made a reservation for 13 people and I asked them on the phone if they serve fish entrees and was told yes, its a fish similar to Sea bass only to find out when we arrived, all they had was fish tacos. Let me tell you the fish tacos had no taste to them and the flavor was very bland. The platters where extremely hot but the food was cold. The prices of their menu was way to high for what you get. Side dishes are very small. They definitely need more selection of fish entrees with larger portions if they went more future business. Our friends had there steak but was told it was not grade A quality meat. Would not recommend this restaurant until they do some improvements. The atmosphere was nice i must say.

qliFpt8wz2yMJXR9FwsswQ.text: One of my favorite places off the strip and never fails they follow through. Great service!!

R3XxMWFAqvGyU4_H35IhAA.text: The food at this place was pretty damn good.  Management, if you're reading this..... appetizers....the Sope Sampler, please make this dish a main course, but bigger.  The guacamole was also pretty good.  We had the chicken enchiladas and the habanero shrimp with carne asada....it met my expectations and then some.  The cocktails where refreshing.  Over all it's a bit pricey but it was worth it.  I left Bandito impregnated with a food baby.  We will be back.

_XnnjbHkFWd0u1safIBAQg.text: The decoration and atmosphere of the restaurant excellent !!  Very average food, I expected something better.  *price of the food is average. * Costumer serves is good.

v2Cmt888gUj8MhxW-aZ9cA.text: Honestly food was cold made me sick to my stomach but can say the drinks were bomb but the food sucks. Just being honest. The inside is nice. The kitchen has to put more effort. Once they do it will be a good spot to go.

bkj6lbuJ4MjvzPTsf-RWPg.text: Jose and Edgar gave us the best service! The food was great. Food was amazing!! Cocktails were perfect and delivered quickly.

VOS8lxeoQwxHV1dhf-k-ZQ.text: Stopped by on our quick Vegas trip. I wish we could have eaten here every night! It was by far the best meal we have had in a long time! I made reservations and there was no wait! Our waitress, and everyone else, was so friendly! Definitely try the enchiladas and watermelon margarita! Yum!

zg7MiVBGX22AMf2L3Qu-Pw.text: The decor in here is really cool and the drink menu is delicious. Our food was good and service was alright. Overall nothing really was bad but nothing stood out either.

1yaecmbtGBKw_DfuRzl12Q.text: I tried to redeem an offer for a buy one get one entree. I was told I couldn't use it due to it being Taco Tuesday. My date ordered tacos, I didn't. Also, upon entering the restaurant we weren't greeted in a timely manner. Instead we were stared at by two people who chatted amongst themselves. One of who ended up being our waitress, when being seated we were rudely notified that the restaurant was closing soon but they'd go ahead and seat us anyway. Well, wasn't that nice of her?! As she took our order, she had the nerve to sit at our table. Like she was a guest. Not something to be done with first time customers. At that moment I asked my boyfriend if he'd like to dine elsewhere since I was put off by the welcome we'd received. I saw this place on the Travel Network and was excited to try it because I live next door and was hoping it would a regular place for me to dine. That will no longer be the case. The first impression left a bad taste in my mouth. The food is mediocre at best and the service was completely unprofessional and rude. I notified the restaurant through FB messenger of my experience, after I kept getting notifications to redeem other offers. At first they appeared to try to fix the unpleasant situation by stating they'd like to make it up to me. A few weeks go by and nothing. Again, I kept receiving offers and decided to opt out of the subscription. I spoke with a person during this message who promised to forward my complaint to the right person. I've yet to hear from that person. Instead I've been blocked from commenting or messaging the restaurant. Very disappointing overall. There are better restaurants surrounding Howard Hughes Center. I'll stick to those. Teach your staff professionalism and manners. The Black tall waitress with the shaved head should be first in line for that training. She most certainly did not deserve the 20% tip I left for her.

hT63rr43licg63aCWB2GIw.text: First try for all who was in my party and as much as we all wanted to like this place, we were all disappointed. We literally asked our server to refill our drinks 6x, we got up from our table to go get them ourselves. Mind you we were watching our server standing in the bar area looking like he was wigging out. We tried calling the other servers but, only one at the end of our meal was the best server we had. We wanted to sit outside and we were placed at a wobbly table, they said the would come and fix it. Next someone shut the lights out while eating dinner.  Now our food....we had tacos, in an oil bath. These servers with an exception of one, still received his tip. We actually told him to keep all of it but he had integrity and gave it to the others who didnt deserve any.

h_TvPOO9xli4LZfqT9X-zQ.text: Amazing food and service, especially Heather! We had a group of eight and got happy hour margaritas, veggie enchiladas, tacos, and the street corn! Sooo good!

jXyjnmPS0dG7MNS8vDDAfg.text: This was our first visit to bandito our server was Jose and he was very nice very attentive and took very good care of us. Had the fish tacos and the barbacoa tacos. The guacamole was just the right size not too much just enough for an appetizer. The drinks were absolutely fabulous I had the Sandia which had some watermelon balls which was absolutely delicious I would definitely be back in order again.

fK6HD-Cw8JImba2xLOX0CQ.text: This is a wonderful addition to Hughes center restaurant row! I have been here on two occasions for happy and hands down my favorite for a Mexican happy hour ! They have a nice selection of draft beers and house wines available for 5$ but the two margarita selections and sangria are where it's at!!! The sangria is red ( white also available ) all margaritas and sangrias are made to order and made with various selections of fresh fruit and juices and each is really a delight to the palette and strong !! All for 5 bucks!! Next the food , we were served complimentary chips and salsas a red and green and both pack the perfect amount of heat !  All the appetizers are half off and there are no bad choices ! The queso fundido is served hot and bubbly and quite frankly the tastiest I've ever eaten  The chicken flautas were crispy and filled with a delicate and flavorful mix of chicken and cheese  The ceviche from what I hear is very tasty and a great mix of complimentary seafood  The tamales each more flavorful than the last  The SOPE sampler , I could not believe for as small as they were each packed a lot of flavor and my friend agrees that even tho the carnitas and beef Barbacoa were great the veggie one was a surprise and the veggie mix did not leave you wanting !!  Also while it lasts don't forget to check it for your free guacamole , although small it's packed with flavor and beautiful presentation and FREE with check in !!  Also I e tried the churro dessert but it was passable a little to doughy or undercooked I could not figure out which  also the street corn as a side is a wonderful accompaniment , it's creamy and cheesey and bursting with fresh off the Cobb flavor  All in all my experience here will keep me coming back and be my go to for happy hour!!

DpFir_WOPHSdkFoqx_X6lg.text: I was all around pretty disappointed in Bandito.  We came with a group for a birthday and I will say the place is gorgeous.  But both service and food were subpar.  Our server was super inattentive.  Aside from being slow to come take drink orders, check in, etc, he seemed confused by the menu.  There was more than one occasion we ordered things directly by name from the menu and he was confused by what we were talking about.  We also had to ask multiple times for certain things.  As far as drinks go, we were kinda "meh" about our selections.  I had the jalapeno elderflower margarita and it wasn't bad by any means, but it definitely didn't have a kick to it.  There was a spear with 2 jalapenos in the drink and that may have been the only spice which didn't give it much before I kind of muddled them in.  A friend had a michelada and thought it was just straight up bad.  I tried the Smokey margarita and personally wasn't impressed but friends did like that one.  As for food, again, meh.  The guacamole, while not bad, wasn't anything spectacular.  A bit bland for me and for the price, it was also a very small portion.  You pay for chips and salsa here and they were good.  I had the shrimp enchiladas and did not care for them.  The habanero blood orange sauce was too sweet for my liking, so maybe just a poor menu choice by me.  A friend had tacos and the tortillas were legit cold and did not seem fresh.  He ate the insides and didn't even bother with the tortillas.  Overall I'd give a 2.5 if I could, but bumped it down to 2 with no desire to try the place out again.  There are much better options in Vegas.

B-ry9OzOvCTknGBiyoAqxw.text: Let me preface this review by saying I have spend a lot of time in Vegas, and I have eaten in many restaurants in this town. I rarely give 5 star ratings because I believe it has to be extraordinary to merit this rating. My experience at Bandito tonight warrants this rating, across the board.   Firstly, I was initially impressed by the exterior and interior design of the restaurant. It is open, airy, modern, and the (open) kitchen and restaurant is immaculate, which goes a long way for me. You feel relaxed and comfortable here.   I was very impressed by the creative and unique menu, which captured all you expect in Mexican food, but adds a creative spin, such as al pastor potatoes. The food was fresh, incredibly tasty, and it was plated and presented extremely well. The portion was also perfect, and unlike most Mexican restaurants which dump as huge heaping portion on the plate, this was well balanced and thought out. My dinner (Carne Asada tacos) and drink (Barbacoa michelada) were delicious and well prepared.   Finally...and certainly not least, the service was impeccable. This tells you so much, and our server Jose was professional, knowledgeable, and Personable. He took the time time to tell us about his favorite foods, and his own experiences growing up in Mexico City. He was friendly, and made us feel welcome. That meant a lot to me.   I was so impressed with this restaurant, and I will absolutely be back to try more of this delectable menu. Certainly a hidden gem in Vegas, and worth going off the strip to try!

Sy0Rs-wUu69eez6W7O7SAw.text: Nice to be somewhere away from strip sadly quality of food disappointed and service was very slow and waiter kept Forgetting our order. Took us forever to get our second set of drinks. Prices are reasonable for Las Vegas.  One plate had cold rice and beans. Like it had been sitting around.   I really wanted to like this place but with so many choices in Vegas I won't be going back.

4bgXVq-YHrGur1jZmcwimA.text: This is not your regular restaurant! Very cool atmosphere with a creative menu. We have loved everything we have tried there so far. My wife really enjoys the fajitas and my favorite is the Habanera Shrimp (add the carne asada!!!)  The staff has been very mindful of food allergies and our waiter, Jose, was one the best we have had in town! He took great care to make sure we enjoyed our food and that there was no risk of food allergy contamination. This has become one of our favorite places to eat when we want a night on the town!

kmT8GIVdnbCDSWG83HQglw.text: Friendly service, good vibe and quality ingredients make this place a winning combo.  Cost is reasonable relative to Vegas prices and drinks were reasonable.  Will definitely go back.

fSMesAo73a4yoY2wN6ldpQ.text: Terrible experience. Came in at Happy Hour and was pretty empty. My buddy ordered the short rib enchilada's which he said were good and I ordered their seared New York steak and it was terrible. If your not going to buy high grade steak at least season or marinade it to give it some flavor. I took two bites and was disgusted. No flavor whatsoever bland, blah. So when the waiter comes by and ask us how is everything and I tell him no good and he just walks off not asking me why or if there was anything he could do not even a discount on the bill while he stands around in an empty restaurant playing with his cell phone. Worst steak I ever tried and a total disregard for an unhappy customer will not come back.

Xv2sp-3aLnnhs-8ZEX84Ig.text: Ambiance: The restaurant itself is so cool to look at. The bar and the open kitchen and incredibly welcoming. I love the overall feel when you walk into the place.   Customer Service: The host upfront was great about seating us 30 minutes before our reservation for happy hour and our waitress was very friendly and responsive to our needs.  Food: This is where we were disappointed. Everything was just meh. We ordered the nachos which were very difficult to eat because of the plate and they way they were stacked. There was next to no cheese and cold beans all over the top.   We thought it was just a fluke because the chips and salsa were so good. So we tried ordering the fried octopus, but unfortunately, they had already removed it from the menu. We then ordered the turkey meatballs, ceviche and sope sampler.   The meatballs were okay, they were well seasoned, but everyone at our table just at one and left the rest. The sope sampler was probably the best out of the three, but still nothing that amazing. But the worst was the ceviche, the shrimp was still gray and there was no flavor whatsoever. We actually sent the ceviche back because we didn't want to risk food poisoning.   Our waitress was so friendly, and she even told us they were still working out some of the kinks on the menu.  Just based off our experiance, I don't think we will be coming back. The food was just overall underwhelming and the enviroment just wasn't dazzling enough to bring us back.

F866Izn_iJR6dIgGeMlpsg.text: Wow!  I was very impressed.  The food was delicious, the vibe was Latin hip, service was on point.  Fantastic!  We will be back for sure!  Heidi

m_cmzw1va-iSVbST5neCWQ.text: Came here for drinks and something small to eat since it was close by. Brand new and only open for 20 days. The interior was nicely decorated and had a very nice ambience. It is a little pricier than other Mexican restaurants and menu items are pretty typical. The tamale plate was ok kinda tasted like store bought tamales you could probably get at Cardenas. The guacamole was good tasted fresh and chunky which is how I like it. The chips and salsa was nothing special. The Chango Wango cocktail was filled with way too much alcohol I didn't even finish it. The barbacoa michelda was interesting. Tasted liked a typical michelda with a saltier taste and it was topped with pieces of barbacoa which was pretty good actually. Probably won't be back here.

6R0mNMGuRYO945vwWn2r-Q.text: Came in for lunch on father's day sunday, couldn't tell if they were open with hardly any cars parked in the lot.  We were greeted right away and got a table in the middle. Very nice place with a cool vibe, the bar looked inviting with a great selection of tequila on the back bar. We ordered the sope sampler and could see the chef carefully putting it together, but overall it wasn't anything special. Carnitas lacked any authentic flavor and the rest was just there with nothing to write home about. I also tried the agua frescas with watermelon and mint, but it must have just been made because it was still at room temperature. I put some ice in from my water and it helped a bit. Also we were informed that they didn't have octopus for one of our taco orders, so two fish taco plates were the lunch of the afternoon. Again, no flavor in the fish and kind of dry, the corn tortillas were cold and tastes like out of a package. Even places like Cafe Rio can do better.  In general the flavors were barely making it, no cilantro, no Mexican cheese, no onions... The place has potential, but kick up the flavors of the food to an authentic Mexican level please.

mLs5nKUS4vQ0CKrti0x81w.text: This place is SOOOOO good.  OMG...the Mexican corn!!  Great ambiance and a beautiful restaurant!

dvT_9NIgCwq6VaeJaDe_-A.text: Chips and salsa were good...chicharrone would have been fabulous except for the overwhelming lime flavor. Down hill from there...the fried octopus was not cooked well. Then it gets worse. For a place that only offered salads, a few entrees and tacos they could put more effort into the tacos. The lunch entree comes with two tacos - but they are street taco size. And terrible. The carnitas & barbacoa were so fatty you couldn't eat them. So disappointing. The rice and beans were dry and flavorless. Very nice ambiance and great staff but the food is simply not worth it.

Gs-LueGOAftN5tvRvdXZlg.text: First time here for the wife and I. It was ok the place has great appeal but the food was ok . A place to Go and check it out.

W15OgkyGQoWRO1jfA-ckWQ.text: When we first arrived the place was still fairly empty.  We got a few more tables as dinner progressed, but nothing to crazy.  Ordered drinks and they were out of items to make the Sandia Margarita. Server suggested we watermelon with tequila so we tried it. It was ok,but nothing to write home about. Then ordered a few appetizers for the table. Queso - it came with caramelize onions and peppers. Was really looking forward to tasting it, but was very disappointed as it was lacking flavor. I'm hoping they tweak the recipe as it has potential but needs some flavor.  Turkey albondigas- these were tasty and would suggest you order. Trio tamales were a good choice in order to get a taste and all three beef, chicken and cheese . They were  ok tasting. A little on the under filled side. The Fried octopus had a a lot of flavor. It was served with fried cauliflower however the dish had more fried cauliflower than octopus.  Chips were ok but the salsa was delicious. Especially the red!  Had the chicken tinga enchilas with achiote chile and also cream green sauce both were good. The enchiladas were different and it definitely was not the original chicken tinga. Instead it was a large piece of chicken on top of cheese enchiladas. Side were adobada potatoes which were just ok.  Rice which was a little undercooked but good flavored  and frijoles charros were ok .   Overall this dish was good, but could use improvement.  Friends had carnitas Tacos which were good and the tortilla soup.  Both were good and worthy of ordering again.  Overall it was good food,but they do need somebody tasting dishes before they come out for flavor. The room decor itself was very nice and different and service was actually very good. They have an outside patio.   It was their first Sunday open so hoping dishes will develop as they get established and look forward to trying this place out again in the near future.

MV3aPZcHqK69F773-fw7hQ.text: wow Wow WOW! This gorgeous spot off the strip was absolutely worth the Uber! This expansive spot has indoor and outdoor seating as well as a beautiful bar in the middle of the restaurant. We opted for table near the wide windows. The service is impeccable. Both our drinks were larger than life and delicious. Everything is made in house and tastes fresh off the heat. If I had room I would've went back for dessert, the options looked DELISH. Would definitely go back again for that pancha!

BQ1SLQbJ7527EBfqO9ggfg.text: By far the best Mexican restaurant in town. Excellent service, waiters, management, etc. Definitely my only go to spot for authentic, high end, Mexican food.

Px45T2VBCVjN-CyTNeR-LA.text: This place is amazing! It has instagram-friendly decor, the staff is extremely nice, food and drinks are great. Our waiter/bartender was super cool,he gave us some nice recommendations. We had seafood sevice as an appetizer, and some tacos, all were good. Octopus tacos are a must-try! One warning though: don't go too hard on free chips and salsa, because portions are pretty big. In had to take half of food to go. Micheladas are great, and mojitos are super refreshing. We were the last ones to leave, and we didn't feel rushed by the staff. It was definitely a 5-Star experience

OlwgTlZm6gkS_xZW4I0-JA.text: This was not a good experience for my family and I we love enceladas they said they have the best?? Well the meat was on The outside of the tortilla?? Just did not like that one bit l. Will will pass others can eat hear??  Food was ok just not what we were expecting??

DlKXqVxqJXpUuEHP9Ulwng.text: My wife and I came to Bandito for dinner and had an excellent time!  The restaurant itself is fashionably decorated and our service start to finish was excellent.  Upon being seated, I started out with the Bandito margarita, which was delicious, not too sweat and well balanced. We had the ceviche for an appetizer which was great, the fish and shrimp were well seasoned and firm in texture (not mushy).  For our entree's I had three of their tacos, octopus, barbarcoa and al pastor, and all were spot on. The octopus was perfectly cooked, the barbarboa was like the perfect mexican pot roast and the al pastor was amazing with charred pineapple.   For my side dish I chose the off the cob Mexican street corn, which was amazing.  My wife had the baseball cut sirloin, and it came out perfectly cooked paired with al pastor roasted potatoes.  In the end we could't have been happier with our meal.  Also a special shout out to our server Jared who delivered outstanding service at every point throughout the meal.

8RRogTVcUrOQiPTx0rXt9Q.text: The best tacos in town.   Also the service is top notch.  I highly recommend the octopus tacos and also the fish tacos.  Everything is good here.

TzpGEpPbylmRpN46AjU9lQ.text: First time at this place. The restaurant itself is nicely decorated and clean. I went for happy hour and the food was mediocre. The service was mediocre as well, it was not extremely busy but I had to hunt my waiter down and remind him of water and refills. Glad I got to try something new though.

n-IPhXNeHQacRkx3xWXr1w.text: I'm a Vegas local, being also in the hospitality business is what brought me to try this new place, I would have to say this has been a phenomenal, very tasteful Mexican cuisine experience. The sopes appetizer platter hits the stop and it's almost as good as grandmas.... lol. My friend and I sat at the bar, we had such great service by the bartenders, they were knowledgeable about their tequilas and mezcal. I would recommend it and definitely come back for more.

QtfPrRELcyk_mVIp9vp5hg.text: This place is an out of the park home run. Perfectly balanced flavors. The heirloom tomato salsa was fantastic. I loved the soup and my tacos were great. I got the watermelon margarita and loved it. Centrally located with a gorgeous interior, there was some real talent in design, in the kitchen and the service was perfect. I'll absolutely come back here as long as they keep up on the quality. This place is 100 times better then border grill on the strip. My only suggestion is that they prep the tortillas on a grill longer. This place is new so getting it this dialed in so early is impressive. I cant wait to come back.

QC2O-3USaqy_b_nAxiQIxw.text: We attended a charity event for Ronald McDonald House at this restaurant last night, and were so happy we did!  Our server Tony, was fabulous, the food was excellent-chips and salsa-authentic with a little kick; Planchas (fajitas) added steak and shrimp-phenomenal! We have never had fajitas with such a wide variety of vegetables-broccoli, cauliflower, carrots!  They have a variety of sauces and sides to choose from in combination with your entree and the portions were perfect! Monica, the manager came over and introduced herself, and made sure everything was to our liking.  I tried a great drink, Chango Wango, a sweet drink made with vodka (ok might have tried more than one since hubby drank water), again it wasn't huge with just the right amount of juice.  Since this was our first time here, we decided to try a dessert, ok maybe two - churros and the brownie.  WOW!  They were both fantastic and the best part, they were not heavy, we were so glad we walked away from the meal feeling comfortable rather than miserable.   We were very pleased with the atmosphere-decor is open and modern, the staff-excellent customer service and food-finally found a great chips and salsa place!  We will definitely be returning to check out the lunch menu as well as Happy Hour!  Thanks to the owner as well for supporting a local non-profit! Definitely a win-win evening for us;)  We definitely recommend and will be bringing all of our Alaskan friends to this place!!

lzL0sVeLY_HGyMFPCWTNLA.text: Just outstanding.  I am a local, I've been here 3 times so far with 3 different sets of friends, and everyone so far is just really impressed. (Including tonight) Honestly, I'm a lazy Yelper. There, I said it. So.....I haven't reviewed before now, because I honestly believed this place would have so many 5 star reviews, that mine wouldn't matter. I was actually shocked to see this place clicking in at a 4. So I started reading them. It seems the prevailing sentiment in any of the poorer reviews, is that it wasn't "Mexican" enough. Not to be preachy here, but it's billed as a Latin Kitchen. Is Mexico part Latin America?  Sure. Is Columbia? Brazil? Guatemala? Chile? Venezuela? Peru? Cuba? Haiti? (I digress) Yes to all of the above, and many more. So if you think it's not Mexican enough, perhaps you should learn a little geography, and maybe just go to a Mexican restaurant. But if you want SO much more than that, then cast aside the burrito, and take a chance on this place. You can really tell a LOT of passion went into the melding of flavors, to deliver a menu that they are clearly, (and rightfully so), very proud of. The staff is extremely knowledgeable about the menu and preparations, and can talk freely  and fluently about any menu item. They are professional, courteous, and attentive, almost bordering on too attentive, which isn't a bad thing. The drink menu is cutting edge, the Habanero Shrimp is divine, (had that tonight) the Barbacoa is outstanding, I could go on and on. Each of my 3 times here, I've had 3 different dishes, and sampled my guest's choices as well, and never had a b-level menu item. I could go on, but I think I've made my point. If you want a cheap burrito, go to Roberto's. (Which is also delicious) If you want a truly next-level culinary experience, with Mexican influence and SOOO much more, give this place a try. I am sold.
